Philosopher/Spiritual Teacher will be at ABC Carpet & Home on Wednesday November 4th, to launch his new book "The Intelligence of Love." I have been attending meeting with John for 16 years - and they are profoundly transformative. His presence opens many doors within. His core message is "openness and softness of heart," and he awakens our full capacity as a human being. Excerpt from new book "The Intelligence of Love: Manifesting Your Being in this World"

"In meetings I show others dimensions within, greater than the world without. There is far more within us than we perceive of the universe, our planet, our lives. Within our interiors are myriad levels of form, like the world outside of ourselves, with systems, structures, and relationships.
You can let these deeper streams into your heart, changing you from the inside out. When we move with authenticity as awareness, that movement isn’t going to be as thought and feeling; it is the movement of the being, and that movement is love."

results.description:
Mindful Astoria: Wednesday Meditation Gathering

Join us on Wednesday nights for meditation and conversation about mindfulness. Learn how to bring mindfulness into daily life, and how to establish, maintain, and deepen a personal mindfulness practice.

Each class will consist of instruction in different forms of mindfulness meditation, and time for group discussion and connecting with the community. Depending on the week, the teacher may give a talk or share a reading about a related topic.

Check out our group guidelines.

Teacher for this night's gathering: Emily Herzlin 

Emily (also the MeetUp group organizer) is a writer, editor, and teacher. She has taught creative writing and mindfulness meditation at Columbia University, The Interdependence Project, Adelphi University, GreenspaceNYC, and Mission to (dit)Mars. Emily has been practicing mindfulness meditation for ten years, and trained in Mindfulness Based Stress Reduction (MBSR) through the Center for Mindfulness at UMass Medical School. She is also a graduate of the Yearlong Immersion and Teacher Training program at the Interdependence Project, where she currently teaches MBSR and a monthly contemplative writing workshop. 

Mindful Astoria

Every Wednesday, 7-8:30pm at the Astoria First Presbyterian Church.

All classes are drop-in, but RSVP. $5-$10 at the door to cover meetup dues and support the teachers and the Astoria Presbyterian Church. *Note that no one will be turned away for lack of funds. If you cannot afford the suggested donation, please give what you are able.

Email any questions to Emily Herzlin at [masked].

Looking forward to deepening practice and strengthening mindful community with you all!

results.description:
Have you ever tried Salsa? How about CUBAN salsa? Now is your chance to learn this exciting and fun dance! On Wednesday, November  4th, we are offering a Cuban-style Salsa TOTAL BEGINNER introduction class! The class will start its curriculum from scratch, will be in a dance studio, and will be kept comfortably small to facilitate learning, so IT DOESN’T MATTER IF YOU HAVE NEVER DANCED! Also, having a partner is not required as we constantly rotate during the class. This format gives you the opportunity to practice your steps with various partners and prepares you for the social dance scene in a safe and pressure-free environment!

The teachers, a male and female, teach progressive levels of Cuban Salsa Partner work, also known as Casino and Rueda de Casino - an interactive group dance where there are constant partner exchanges with fun patterns executed in unison!

The November session of Cuban Salsa:

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

7:00-8:30pm Beginner Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino  - Level 1

This class is for absolute beginners with little to no dance experience and will allow you to develop a strong foundation in Cuban Salsa in an extremely fun, stress-free atmosphere. In each 90-minute class of the four week series, students focus on developing dance fundamentals including rhythm, coordination, balance, and the specific technical aspects of Cuban Salsa, including basic steps and turn patterns, partnering technique, and the fundamental motions of Casino and Rueda de Casino. Students will also learn social dancing etiquette, floorcraft, and partner <a>safety in</a> an extremely warm, relaxed, social and fun environment. If you can walk, you can do this, so let your friends with two left feet know!

PRICE
-For First Time members & their guests, 1st Class: ONLY $10, 50% OFF!!!
Normally $20 Drop-In!
-Level 1 full month package of 4 Classes: ONLY $60
that's 4 classes (6 hours total) for the price of 3!!!

LOCATION
Adelante Studios
25 West 31st Street between Broadway & 5th Avenue
2nd Floor - Grand Ballroom (3,000 sq ft!)

Nearby Subways: 34th St Station on B, D, F, M, N, Q, R, & PATH trains.
*Can't find us? Call[masked] and we'll point you in the right direction.

All classes are taught by both a male, Chris, and female, Nayelli, so women can easily follow another woman while men are following a man at the same time! They have over 15-years of training, teaching, performing, and traveling to Cuba to collaborate with the very best in the Salsa world. Feel free to contact them at any time for additional info or if you have any questions.

Chris: [masked] /[masked]

Video link of our group doing Rueda de Casino
https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=UK02-HTye7k
http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

For those with previous experience dancing Casino, we offer a Level 2/Intermediate class immediately following Level 1 on Wednesdays at 8:30pm.

Intermediate - Level 2

Wednesdays (October 28th - November 18th):

8:30 - 10:00pm Intermediate Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 2

This progressive, 90-min class is geared for those that have danced Cuban Salsa and/or Rueda before and allows you to further solidify, fine-tune, and expand upon the basics covered in Level 1. Here is your opportunity to refresh all of the beginning motions at a pace that is comfortable for you while further building a solid foundation in this exciting, interactive, and fun dance. This high-energy class focuses on combinations, leading and following technique, group moves, styling, body motion, and fun salsa suelta footwork. By the end of the 8-week sequence, you will have all the tools necessary to get out on the dance floor and be fun, fluid, and spontaneous with everything you've learned. *For those that register for Level 2, Level 1 is included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=cINgMRwiL7Q

***************************************************

We also offer classes at the advanced level on Tuesdays (October 27th) at Adelante Studios.  Here's the info -

7:00 - 8:30pm Intermediate-transition-to-Advanced Cuban Salsa & Rueda de Casino - Level 3

This progressive series serves as a bridge class for intermediate dancers who have already completed Level 2 and are ready to step up their game. The focus is on technique, as we will provide you with insights on what advanced dancers are constantly attending to while engaging with their partner. Each 90-minute session is broken down into 3 parts - Suelta (Footwork & Movement), Casino (One-on-One Partnering), and Rueda - all danced to rhythmically dense Timba. By the end of this 8-week series, you will be equipped with all the necessary tools to make a seamless transition into the advanced level. *For those that register for Level 3, Levels 1 & 2 are included as extra practice, free of charge, in your monthly package.*

Sample Video: http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=rSHUoyjfxlA

Location:

Adelante Studios

2nd Floor
Grand Ballroom

results.description:
People who are skilled in Emotional Intelligence are more successful than people with high IQ!

An interactive group coaching experience to help you master your emotions!

Are your emotions ruling you? Do feel strongly about things and have difficulty moving past your feelings? Does it take you days to process and understand what you feel? If you wish you had more emotional control and intelligence and are seeking to have a more even emotional life, this 12-week online group coaching series is for you.

The Details
The series will begin Wednesday, October 21st, 2015, at 7:00pm EST. Live video conferences take place every Wednesday from 7:00pm to 9:00pm EST (12 sessions in total) with unlimited Q & A with Pierre on the private Facebook Group Page.

Session One: Understand human biology and the provenance of your emotions, from the limbic system to the release of hormones, which change your cellular structure. Learn how to manage your emotions: identify what you are feeling and legitimize your perception of pain and suffering.

Session Two: Learn about the Desire to Give and the Desire to Receive: the two great impulses that create the Tao, Chi or Prana, which permeates the entire Universe. How do you enter into an exchange in a balanced manner, aligned with spiritual laws?

Session Three: Fear is the result of a perception that the outside world has negative intentions toward us. It has many forms, but its roots are about fragmentation and separation. It is the loss of merger. Learn how to manage your fear and to determine if your fear is real or perceived.

Session Four: When we feel emotions that trouble us, we tend to judge and repress them, or worse, try to distract and medicate ourselves into a different state of being. Emotional intelligence implies the management of emotions, both good and bad.

Session Five: Love is the positive force that creates merger and blending. It allows us to overcome the basic untruth of separation in 3-D reality. Addressing self-love a with body image: How do we value ourselves, and what kinds of programs are sabotaging our self-worth and value? A look at your childhood and inner child will heal your unworthiness better than any other tool.

Session Six: You can only truly love someone to the degree that you love yourself. Giving while being empty will bankrupt your emotional life for you are only giving because you think you are underserving. Sharing your love with others is the most powerful act of blending that you can do: conditional love vs. unconditional love; attachment vs preference.

Session Seven: We feel positive emotions that tend to uplift and give us good feelings. However, there may be higher emotions for which we understand the dictionary definition but to which we have no actual visceral reaction. Evolve a connection to higher emotions, such as empathy, detachment, and unconditional love.

Session Eight: Listening is a skill that can be learned. Often we say that we are listening. But we are in fact deep in thought or judging the individual telling the story. To listen is to observe without objections. You have to have a deep level of empathy to be able to do this effectively. Saying the Ho’oponopono helps us become neutral and gives us the tolerance to listen.

Session Nine: We exist in social settings, and we are interacting with each other in family, social, national, and international situations. Emotions are infectious and can be communicated without verbal clues. This is done through the amygdala in the brain. Individuals who are highly emotionally intelligent can walk into a room and change the mood of the space.

Session Ten: Neutrality is not disengagement from the injustices of the world. It is a way to engage without being polarized. It is observation without objection. To listen and enhance your social intelligence, you have to listen more effectively, and nothing can increase your listening more than being neutral and observing without objections.

Session Eleven: Our power to empathize is not limited to sensing other human beings. Given the right kind of consciousness, we can listen to all natural forces for they have a subtle intelligence. It is a kind of intelligence that is heartfelt, and it cannot deceive the forces of nature. They can read your heart and intention. It is a blending of two or more essences.

Session Twelve: The earth is not an inert mass; rather it is a living organism with a complex series of interconnected processes and systems that balance each other to maintain organic life. Our survival on earth hinges on our assimilation of these processes and supporting the sustainable flow of them. Learn how to listen to the earth.


Find out more! Click here to register for the workshop and more Emotional Intelligence Workshop or email [masked].

Hope to see you then!
results.name: Emotional Intelligence - 12 Weeks Online Series!

All small businesses are in desperate need of competent legal advice and legal services, but everywhere you turn there are attorneys who charge a lot and do nothing.


At this meeting we will share some horror stories and warning signs, as well as some strategies to give your small business access to affordable legal advice and services.


One horror story is the small businesswoman who paid an attorney $3000 for a simple letter that the attorney botched. When the letter backfired and she wound up in court she couldn't get so much as a return call from the attorney. How can you prevent this from happening to you?

(Affordable lawyers please feel free to post your services/ introductions in comments section)

results.description:
Men's Pick-up basketball in Hunters Point, Long Island City.

The cost is $10.75 for this session. 

Once you RSVP to a specific session, no refunds or credits will be offered. Please be 100% sure that you can attend before committing to that session.

It is a regulation sized court, but we divide it into two games simultaneously with each playing 4x4. We will do our best to break up the teams evenly at the outset, after which it's the luck of the draw based on who's sitting and who shoots in from the losing team. There will be a sign-up list for each court, and players from the losing team must shoot foul shots to play next, not be chosen by those already sitting.

All skill levels are encouraged to attend. Please have a fun, positive, and supportive attitude. No fighting, rough playing, or screaming allowed. You will immediately be asked to leave the gym.

No food or alcoholic beverages allowed into the school. Save it for after the game.

All games must end by 8:45pm

From Grand Central it's 3 minutes/1 stop on 7 Train. Take 7 train to Vernon Jackson. Walk straight back towards the River to Center Blvd(in the direction of the city).
results.how_to_find_us: High School on Center Blvd (aka Academy for Careers in Television and Film)  1-50 51st Ave, Long Island City, NY

results.description:
What is a BetaTalk?

A BetaTalk is part of BetaNYC's monthly thought-leader salon series. These events demystify BetaNYC, the civic technology, data, design, and the thought leaders behind it all.

For this BetaTalk, we will dive into BetaNYC's 2016 activities. 

 * Recap of CityGram Saturday
 * Update on community leadership
 * A look at 2016's events
 * School of Data NYC, our March 2016 spring hackathon

-=-=-

Community resources:

For first timers trying to get the most out of the night, you should bring your laptop, power supply, and watch the following videos -- Civic Hacking 101 & Civic Hacking 102.

 * Check out conversations on talk.beta.nyc
 * Join a real time conversation via slack.beta.nyc
 * Data tools: Data.Beta.NYC, data resources, maps, & tools 
 * Community projects in process - projects.beta.nyc

-=-=-


Event Partners:

The Code for America Brigade program is an international network of people committed to using their voices and hands, in collaboration with local governments, to make their cities better.

Microsoft Civic aims to collaboratively address the most pressing community challenges through the hyper-local creation, deployment, and evangelism of civic technology.

Accela provides civic engagement solutions for government. Accela’s solutions uniquely address the diverse needs of their constituents by making publicly available information more accessible. The Accela Civic Platform includes solutions for land management, asset management, licensing and case management, legislative management, right of way management, citizen relationship management, recreation and resource management, environmental health and safety.

-=-=-

Note about the venue:

You should RSVP with the name that appears on a photo ID. In order to give building security an RSVP list, RSVPs will close at 4:00 PM the day of the event. If you miss this deadline, most of the time security is nice and will let you in.

BetaNYC is committed to hosting safe and open events for all. By attending this event you are committing yourself to BetaNYC's Code of Conduct and Anti-Harassment Policy.
results.how_to_find_us: Use the front staircase; we'll be in the "coworking" space.
results.name: BetaTalk - BetaNYC in 2016

group.name: #BetaNYC, NYC's open data, open gov, & civic tech community

results.description:
This event is proudly brought to you by Soccer Beyond!

Learn more on SoccerBeyond.com or Facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

Details - Fun, interactive, effective.

60min. This is a Coed Soccer Lesson. Please bring a ball if you have. Sneakers, running and turf shoes are fine. Bring some water or sports drink and maybe sun blocker. Please note our Waiver of Liability and 24hr Cancellation Policy below. More details follow.

Rain or Shine - If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Our sessions will be held as scheduled if weather allows. Thunder or snow and ice are among the reasons for sessions to be canceled/ moved. BUT: Don't make assumptions - you will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved. As the weather changes quickly in NYC, occasionally we may make the final decision about 90min prior to session start. If you don't hear from us, the session is on!

Cancelled/ Moved Sessions - You will always get notified!

Every time we have to cancel a session, if possible, we move it to the same day and time of the following week. In this case, all players keep their spots. Please email us prior to the rescheduled event, if you can't make and wish a refund or credit. The 24 hours cancellation policy applies. You will always get notified if a class is canceled/ moved.

Requesting a Refund

To request a refund 1) change your status to "not going" and 2) send us a note with the Paypal transaction number related to the payment for the respective session. Refunds are processed once a week - please be patient.


24 Hours Cancellation Policy

A full refund/ credit will be given if cancellation is received at least 24 hours prior to lesson start. Full payment is required thereafter. Our cancellation policy also applies to package holders.


Waiver of Liability and Hold Harmless Agreement

By RSVP'ing for this event you certify that you are physically fit such as you are able to participate in this program. You therewith voluntarily release CoachFrankNYC/ Soccer Beyond, LLC from any and all liability resulting from or arising out of your participation and/ or receipt of instruction. You read and agree to the WAIVER OF LIABILITY AND HOLD HARMLESS AGREEMENT to be found on SoccerBeyond.com/pages/waiver.

Please let us know if you have any questions or suggestions.

Coach Frank 
M. [masked]

SoccerBeyond.com
[masked]


Feel free to like us on http://www.facebook.com/SoccerBeyond.

results.description:
Not your Uncle Joe's Hunan Cuisine!

Henan (Central China) cuisine is wheat based and noodles supersede rice. It's not as spicy as Szechuan, rather different from Hunan, and altogether wonderful. See (and taste) for yourself!

Our tentative menu includes:

Lamb dumplings
Dial Oil Hand-Drawn Noodle
Potato with Hot Sour Sauce
Tofu Henan Style
Celery and Dried Bean Curd with Shredded Pork
Cumin Powder Fried Lamb
Spicy Crispy Chicken in Big Tray
Baked Noodle and Fish in Sweet & Sour Sauce
Spicy Crispy Shrimp

• Everyone will share the dishes that we order.  Expect the cost to be approximately $25 per person including tax and tip.  In order to cover our fees to Meetup.com, we will charge members $1 over the food/tax/tip bill at each event.

• Drinks will go on a separate check and must be paid for individually by those who have ordered them.

• Please bring cash, small bills preferred.

• RSVP etiquette. We often have a waitlist of people wanting to join us. Please RSVP responsibly.  If you must change your RSVP, please do so at least 24 hours before the scheduled time.  If you have an emergency the day of, please change your RSVP and also send the organizer an email through the site.

We're looking forward to dining with you!

results.description:
The world of work is changing directly as a result of the World Wide Web. The idea of location might become completely obsolete.

This will be a discussion about the rise of the remote work force. The rise of teleworking for not only freelancers but individuals. And the rise of the traveling digital nomad.

Presenters will be:
Kash Miah- Head of Content Marketing at Fiverr
Koby Lazar- A second professional photographer and 2nd tier seller on Fiverr that is a high school student. Koby source of part time income and college saving is generated strictly through earning money through micropayment platforms to sell stop motion animated services.
Mark Stansberry- a professional 2d animator living in Harlem , New York. Mark has been producing and teaching traditional animation over 20 years. He has worked on animated television series' as well as national and local animated television commercials and currently developing a animated series with rap legend "Kool Keith" for a certain animated network.

The discussion will answer questions pertaining to the outlook of the microeconomy and peer-to-peer economy, remote working, and how internet globalization has made it possible to generate revenue from buyers and sellers anywhere and everywhere in the world.

Please RSVP on Eventbrite https://www.eventbrite.com/e/the-future-of-work-and-the-3rd-industrial-revolution-tickets-18198520264
results.name: Gig Economy, Fiverr, and Future of Work

results.description:

The idea of locaiton might become completely obsolete. This will be a discussion with Fiverr about the rise of the remote work force. The rise of teleworking for not only freelancers but individuals. And the rise of the traveling digital nomad. If you have a speaker you would like to suggest present please advise.

This will also go into discussion on how the idea of micro-payment and outsourcing work online might become part of our every day life and even part of working for the government and large corporations.

results.description:
From Terrence Taylor:

In 2001, at the age of 47, I left Los Angeles to return home to New York to finally finish a novel I had been poking at for twenty years, determined to finish it once and for all, so I wouldn’t regret not having tried at 70. By 2009, that novel was released as a trade paperback by Macmillan’s Griffin Press, followed by a second six months later, in a two book deal.  

I had finished the first draft of the novel within five years of my return(the second written in less than one year), and then the real work began, to hone that manuscript into a publishable novel and find an agent. I chose the traditional route to publication, and want to share the experiences that got me through completing my first draft, through over 30 rejections to an agent, and through the publication process.

Ultimately I want to share two messages — that it is never too late to try to take your writing seriously, that perseverance can lead to success, and though writing for publication is more work than most people believe, I can make the process more clear, step by step.

TERENCE TAYLOR (terencetaylor.com) is an award-winning children's television writer whose work appeared on PBS, Nickelodeon, and Disney, among many others. As an author of fiction, his first published short story, “Plaything”, appeared in "Dark Dreams", the first horror/suspense anthology of African-American authors. He was one of a handful of authors to be included in the next two volumes, with “The Share” in “Voices from the Other Side” and WET PAIN in “Whispers in the Night”. Terence is also author of the first two books of his Vampire Testaments trilogy, “Bite Marks”, and Blood Pressure”.  After a two-year hiatus he has returned to the conclusion of his trilogy, "PAST LIFE". Find him on Twitter @vamptestaments.
results.name: So You’re Writing Your First Novel…Expert Meeting with Terrence Taylor

results.description:
Join us for Summer Tennis.

Check in at Clubhouse for court assignment upon arrival, then play under the lights 'til 10:00pm at this beautiful wooded park*.

Please remember to check in with the clubhouse to reserve a court. Players need to reserve a court with at least one other player present and should be a Hudson County resident with ID.

Mention to the court staff that you are with the Meetup group and ask that they keep us together if possible (3 courts).

Make sure you only use 3-4 of the same numbered balls. Public courts do not allow use of more than 6 balls per court.

Also please try to use the same age balls as it will help you improve your game. And remember to bring plenty of water!

You can find each other in the waiting area and/or looking on the courts. It would help if you make a mental note of the profile picture of those attending. I will provide my cell # for RSVP's so we can find each other. Please also bear in mind that we are usually on more than one court - they are available on a first-come, first-serve basis. You should locate other players and grab a court when you arrive.

Although we won't enforce attendance, please keep your rsvp updated because others are looking to find partners to hit with. Remove your name from the list if you are not planning to attend.

Inclement weather cancels the event.

If you have any questions, feel free to email the organizer.

Thank you all for this great group!

*Free for Hudson County residents. Those outside of Hudson County may play as a guest of the resident players to avoid a possible $10 fee to play.

Note:  Everyone must RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/fiverr-the-future-of-work-and-the-3rd-industrial-revolution-tickets-18198520264

This discussion about the future of work will have two animators who use the micro-economy and sharing economy for income. Many have defined the sharing economy as making up "the third industrial revolution." One of the presenters is an animator and photographer uses it as a sole source of income, and one is an animator that uses it for part-time income.

Kash Miah- Head of Content Marketing at Fiverr

Koby Lazar- A second professional photographer and 2nd tier seller on Fiverr that is a high school student. Koby source of part time income and college saving is generated strictly through earning money through micropayment platforms to sell stop motion animated services.

Mark Stansberry- a professional 2d animator living in Harlem , New York. Mark has been producing and teaching traditional animation over 20 years. He has worked on animated television series' as well as national and local animated television commercials and currently developing a animated series with rap legend "Kool Keith" for a certain animated network.

The discussion will be moderated by futurist, Paul Rothbein. Paul Rothbein will ask questions pertaining the outlook of the microeconomy and peer-to-peer economy, remote working, and how internet globalization has made it possible to generate revenue from buyers and sellers anywhere and everywhere in the world.

Please make sure to RSVP on Eventbrite http://www.eventbrite.com/e/fiverr-the-future-of-work-and-the-3rd-industrial-revolution-tickets-18198520264

results.description:
D&D Encounters is an episodic-format event designed to allow new players to join in and learn D&D in a casual, pick-up game. Seasoned players with erratic schedules can easily hop in and out of Encounters; unlike a traditional campaign, DMs and players will rotate, resulting in a dynamic game experience. We are using the latest edition of D&D (5e) and each session lasts about 3-4 hours, easily fitting into your work or school schedule, and presents a new and exciting challenge each week. The $10 fee covers your use of the playspace, though committing to 10 weeks grants the player a discount.


We're always on the lookout for DM talent for this season-- volunteers keep programs like this one alive! However, more important than veteran DMs, Encounters is a place where even new players should feel comfortable testing out the DMing waters. Every Saturday we provide our DMs with that week's "adventure chunk", a set of 2-3 encounters in one simple, easy-to-read packet. This bite-sized DMing format is ideal for new DMs and veterans who don't have the time to create an entire campaign from scratch, and allow lots of room for alterations and improvisations as the DM sees fit. DMs who volunteer their time do not pay the $10 fee, and receive a steep discount on our D&D related products.


For our first session, we will be creating level 1 characters and running a brief "test run" of our new adventurers as they get their footing the world of the Forgotten Realms. It won't be long before we're on the road to great deeds, so you won't want to miss this great opportunity to get to know your fellow heroes!

Please private message Timm with any questions regarding DMing, the event, or anything else RPG related!
results.name: Brooklyn Strategist Presents: D&D Encounters, Rage of Demons

results.description:
You're invited to join us for this weekly opportunity to sharpen your drawing skills! This session is open to sketchers of all levels.

What makes our sessions different? 

• We start on time in a large, clean, well-lit space. 

• Sketchers can concentrate because our room is quiet while the model is posing.

• We have coffee and cookies at the long break. 

• We finish on time so you can be headed home at 9:00 p.m sharp! 

• (Latecomers can be seated at a break.)


• This is a two hour drawing session to work from a live (nude) model.  

• We start with short 2 minute poses and work up to a 20 minute pose by the end of the session. We take a 5 minute break every 20 minutes. 


• There are seats for everyone tables and several light weight easels. 


• Access to a sink is available for watercolor artist.

• Bring your own materials (no oil or acrylic paint and no sprays please.)

As always if you have any questions please feel free to email me. I look forward to seeing you there. 

Simon

results.description:
Hello dear Hashi Healers,

We are delighted to introduce you to Dr. Jolene Brighten who will share with us how to Navigate Fertility, Pregnancy, and Postpartum with Thyroid Disease.

Invite anyone who you think will benefit this amazing opportunity.


Hashimoto’s thyroiditis is the most common autoimmune condition affecting women and presents unique challenges for women wishing to conceive. Together we will explore the unique considerations surrounding fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum for women who want to thrive and make healthy babies, even with autoimmunity. Attendees will walk away with actionable information to start improving their overall health and fertility.

Bio:

Dr. Jolene Brighten earned her doctorate in Naturopathic Medicine from the National College of Natural Medicine. She received her BS in Nutrition Science and completed graduate coursework in molecular nutrition at Cal Poly, San Luis Obispo. She has extensive training in Integrative Women’s Health and autoimmune disease management and she is a practicing Holistic Pelvic Care(TM) provider. Having developed Hashimoto’s following the birth of her son, Dr. Brighten is a strong advocate for the Hashimoto’s community, with special emphasis in fertility, pregnancy, and postpartum thyroiditis. She is the author of the book, Healing Your Body Naturally After Childbirth— The New Mom’s Guide to Navigating the Fourth Trimester, and is launching a new program aimed to support fertility and healthy pregnancies for the Hashimoto’s community. She is a regular contributor to several publications and websites and lectures on the subject of postpartum care, autoimmunity, and women’s health to both healthcare providers and the public.

This is not a self-improvement course - it's a series intended to help you develop your inherent nature by recognizing your kindness, connection, and wisdom. Everything you're looking for is already here, let us help you discover it.

This six-week course, 10/28-12/9, incorporates western psychological techniques with traditional contemplative practices to help you develop a healthy relationship to yourself and others. 

Though compassion is often regarded as a weak and cowardly response to difficult people and situations, traditional practices and modern psychological research suggest that compassion is the most effective and courageous quality for creating respectful and loving relationships.  With this unique offering, we’ll learn how to use discernment to create healthy boundaries, how to work with guilt and shame, and how to work with judgement and criticism with understanding and patience. 


You can drop in to any class for $20.  Brainiacs can register for the entire six week series at a discounted price of $80 by selecting the "Basic member" option at the below link. 


More details and registration:

http://theidproject.org/events/2015/10/28/compassionate-relationships

We are located on the 2nd floor of a walk-up building.  There is no elevator.  Cushions and chairs will be provided.
results.name: Developing Compassionate Relationships
NCFRW Hosts its First Wednesdays Series - Refugee Resettlement

results.description:
Please join us on Wednesday evening for a 6ish mile, casual-pace loop run.

Don't be intimidated by the title. This is still a go-at-your-own pace run, with stops and looping back for people. We just kindly suggest that you take it at your not-so-casual pace, whatever that may mean to you.

We will meet just inside the 52nd Street entrance to Windmuller Park at 7:15pm and head out for a 6ish mile loop through Woodside, Sunnyside, LIC, and Greenpoint, before returning to the start. 

For our evening runs, we will wait up to 10 minutes to allow for late-arrivals. This can mean we will wait for 2 minutes or 10. Please be prompt. 

If there is interest after we complete our run, we may venture to a pub for snacks and/or beverages.


- - - - - - 
 Please see our full calendar of events
http://www.woodsidesunnysiderunners.com/events/calendar/
connect with us on Google+
http://www.google.com/+WoodsideSunnysideRunners
like us on Facebook
https://www.facebook.com/WoodsideSunnysideRunners
and follow us on Instagram
https://instagram.com/woodsidesunnysiderunners/
- - - - - -

WOMEN ONLY EVENT. Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene. 

Come meet your new BFF at our Ladies Networking Night!

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to parties, clubs, bars, and everything else a single women doesn't want to hit "solo." 

Meet up to 30 other fabulous women (20s & 30s) at our upscale speed networking event. Also, enjoy $4 beer and $5 wine drink specials. 

We'll start you off in groups where you'll get to meet 3-4 women at a time and then we'll transition to a less formal mixer where you all can mingle at your leisure. 

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

1st 5 women to get tickets save $5 by using discount code "BFF" at checkout ($20). MUST BUY TICKET IN ADVANCE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/dates/Nov-04-2015_at_0730PM

results.description:
Welcome all writers and thank you for joining!

Our agenda is as follows:

7:30-8:00 - set writing goals for upcoming week & share obstacles

8:00-8:30 - provide feedback for the chosen pieces & choose new works for following meeting

8:30-9:00 - craft discussion

9:00-9:15 - wind down & poll group

How to receive feedback:

IF you would like to be critiqued, you must attend at least one meetup to become familiar with and understand the format of the meetings. Attendees are expected to eventually submit work for feedback. In the preceding meetup we choose two writers to be critiqued. The third work is a backup if time permits. Please read them all as well as the craft essays in the "Files" section under "More" tab.

How to post:

1) Post only if you have been chosen to be critiqued and by Friday at noon. (For critique outside of meetups please post in "Pages" in the menu above.)

2) Before Posting: Long-Form Length: 3,000 words or 10 pgs max (can be shorter)

If submitting poems, max 3 a person

Double-spaced (unless for aesthetics)

11-12 point font (no smaller or larger)

Number your pages

*The organizing team maintains the right to remove pieces from circulation

3) Post in Files under More tab with this description:

- Name

- Meetup date

- Description of your work

- Type of feedback you would like

- Fiction or non-fiction specified

(As description box allows.)

When critiquing: (Always use "I" when critiquing)

1) Each person is allotted 5 mins. The writer is also allotted 5 mins to respond after everyone has spoken.

2) Share what worked and/or what you liked/ enjoyed and why.

3) Offer suggestions/ constructive criticism for improvement.

*Caffé Bene has a large assortment of coffees and teas and tasty things to eat. Please pay for your space with a purchase from the establishment.

*A listing of contests and magazines to submit to can be found on our Discussions page

See you there,
results.name: Critique, Goal Setting, & Craft Discussion

results.description:
Come join us for our climbing Meetup!!

As usual, everyone is welcome to join in on the fun as long as you're at least 18 years old, whether you’re a complete beginner just looking to give the sport a try or a seasoned veteran that can show the best of us a few new tricks. Bring your friends too, even if they've never tried climbing before. We'll make sure everybody is set up and having a blast. Age and strength don't even matter, everybody has fun.

1st time climbers at The Rock Club get in for FREE! All you have to do is rent a harness and shoes for $9. Returning Meetupers get a discounted daypass rate of $15. And be sure to have a look out at the gym for other special Meetup discounts.

We also host a special Meetup 101 class from 7:30 - 9pm for Meetup members only. When multiple people sign-up for the class you pay only $45 ($15 discount!).

Reserve your spot with the booking button and enter the promo code "Meetup" on the booking page.

IMPORTANT!!  This offer has restrictions. It is only valid for the Weds night Meetup 101 class, you must already be a meetup member and RSVP for the meetup as well (no guests).

If this is your first time climbing just come on in and join the group. There’s no need to take the class just yet. You’ll be able to join other Meetup members who already have their belay certification. This way you’ll be able to get up and on the wall right away! When you decide that you absolutely love climbing (which you will!), then you can sign up for the class the following week.

As a heads up, when you come into the gym, the front desk staff will get you set up with gear and get you in the system. There will also be name tags for everyone. Wear them with pride so everyone knows who’s a part of Meetup!

DETAILS - Please read carefully!

RSVPing and Questions:
If you're attending the belay course you MUST call TRC to reserve your space.
If you have any questions, please email TRC directly: [url][masked][/url]

Time:
The closer to 7pm you arrive, the better. The 101 class starts at 7:30 sharp.

Directions & Transportation:
Please save time and aggravation by getting directions from our website (BEFORE you call or email us for directions :-). If you're coming on Metro North as a group (2 or more people!) we'll pick you up from the train station. Use the message baord to connect with other riders.  Just give us a call to let us know when you'll arrive. Go to the taxi stand in front of the station building!

We're looking forward to seeing you soon!
results.name: Weekly Climbing Meetup - New members climb for free!!

group.name: The New York Metro Rock Climbing Meetup

results.description:
Come rehearsal with us at our regular location, the Music Conservatory of Westchester! No need to prepare, just show up with your instrument and get ready to play. We have around 30-40 people at most rehearsals (most members are not on the Meetup page) so don't worry, you will have a full orchestra to play with.

RSVP on Meetup to let us know you're coming, or email [masked].

Parking: The Conservatory asks that orchestra musicians *not* park in the Conservatory parking lot unless you are a tuition paying student of either the Conservatory of the Steffi Nossen School of Dance. Street parking is free after 6pm, and there is a large municipal lot across Central Ave from City Limits (24hr meters in the lot).

The first rehearsal is free. Subsequent rehearsals are $10/rehearsal or a discounted annual rate.
results.how_to_find_us: Northern end of Central Ave, just south of City Limits Diner and across rt. 119 from the County Center
results.name: Rehearse with the New Westchester Symphony Orchestra

results.description:
From a Buddhist perspective, we are all suffering from painful attachments that can manifest as addiction, depression, confusion, and powerlessness. The teachings of Buddha provide a clear and simple pathway to freedom from these negative states of mind.

Through practicing time tested meditation techniques, we will reduce and eventually eliminate these painful mental habits.
$15.00 Suggested donation. No one turned away for lack of funds.
results.how_to_find_us: Meditatenj.org
results.name: Attachment, Craving and Desire@Ridgewood

venue.address_2: Use black double doors at south end of Jackson st.
venue.name: MakerBar

results.description:
The programming language night group meets once a month to explore the uses of unfamiliar (to us (mostly)) languages. We like to find what they can teach us over the course of a few hours and explore how we might use them (or might not) in the future.

We're exploring x86 assembly language this month, and will choose another language for the months following. You can find an IDE for x86 at (http://www.rayseyfarth.com/ebe/) which may be helpful.

[PLEASE NOTE: All minors must be accompanied by parent and or guardian.]

MakerBar is a 501(c)3 NJ Non-Profit Organization.. All donations are tax deductible.....consider donating today...Help keep the H@ck3ry alive! 

Interested in membership? Speak to one of our members about the many benefits of membership as well as the outstanding community that is Hoboken's MakerBar. Hudson County's one and only Hackerspace.

http://www.makerbar.com

twitter: @MakerBar

facebook: http://www.facebook.com/TheMakerBar
results.name: Programming Language Night: x86 edition

results.description:
The Place:

Noreetuh is a casual Hawaiian inspired restaurant located at 128 First Avenue in the East Village of New York City by Chef Chung Chow and his partners Gerald San Jose and Jin Ahn. The menu has strong ties in Japanese, Korean and Filipino cuisines and is inspired from his influences growing up in Hawaii and living in Japan.

The restaurant’s goal is to create an atmosphere where guests can enjoy artfully crafted food paired with an approachable wine list in an enjoyable and casual environment, thus lending to the name noreetuh, which means playground in Korean.

Please Note: Fay will be the host for this Meetup.


RSVPs:

Please don't RSVP unless you are sure you can go. I do notice the people who RSVP and then cancel which really isn't fair to everyone else. I reserve the right to give priority to people who don't do this in the future. I'm not trying to be mean or anything but it makes it much harder for me when people take spots and then cancel either quickly or last minute. Obviously more notice is better but please try to only sign up (for waitlist as well) if you know you can come.

Also even if the meetup is full please do put your name on the waitlist. I always give priority to people on the waitlist if spots open up. I will also try to give an idea in advance if it looks like there might be more spots. Also, if there are a lot of people on the waitlist I will try to get more seats, although for reservations made far in advance I am unlikely to succeed. At very least it will let me know what kinds of restaurants are popular so I can schedule more of those in the future. Thanks.
results.name: Noreetuh- Hawaiin Food

results.description:
This is a casual in-store wine tasting event, usually on the 1st Wednesday of every month, featuring a selection of 3 wines and light refreshments.

Join the Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club at The Artisan Collective for wine sipping and socializing in a fun and unpretentious environment.  Each month we will taste and discuss three new wines.  This event is a great way to develop your wine tasting skills, learn about different wines and meet other wine enthusiasts!

Upcoming Tasting Dates & Themes

• 7/1:  Drink Local (NY & NJ Wines)

• 8/5:  South African Wines

• 9/2 - Italian Wines Part I (Northern Italy)

• 10/7 - Italian Wines Part II (Southern Italy & Islands)

Admission: $10

Directions:  NJ Transit to Newark Penn Station or Broad Street Station.

From Newark Penn Station: Take the Light Rail to NJ PAC/Center Street and walk approximately 2 blocks West to the corner of Central & Halsey Street (cross Broad Street). Turn left onto Halsey and walk to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.

From Broad Street: Take the Light Rail to Washington Park.  Turn right onto Washington Street, then left onto Halsey Street.  Walk 1.5 blocks South on Halsey Street (cross Central Ave) to the Artisan Collective, located at 25 Halsey Street.
results.name: Wine Tasting Wednesdays

group.name: Sipper's Delight Wine Tasting Social Club - NJ/NY

results.description:
Let's play Crokinole on Wednesday nights!


Don't know Crokinole? It's like a table-top version of curling, shuffleboard, darts and billiards. If you like just one of these games, you'll probably dig Crokinole.

To learn more about this traditional Canadian game (circa 1860) and about our specific weekly sessions at Milk and Roses, then read the papers!


We've been in a few rags lately, and the best-written article is this one... from the Toronto Star: http://www.thestar.com/news/insight/2015/07/26/crokinole-gains-a-following-in-brooklyn-thanks-to-canadian-expat.html

Same place as usual: Milk and Roses (1110 Manhattan Ave in Greenpoint, between Dupont and Clay).

Same time as usual: 7:30pm 'till close.

Please RSVP if you'd like to join in! If I know how many people are coming, then I can be sure to have enough boards present and polished for plenty of playing time for all :)
results.name: Wed Night Crokinole!

results.description:
Your inner child needs to know that it is safe, loved, acknowledged and embraced. In our meditation we will gift our inner child with the light and love of its highest potential, reclaiming our innocence, creativity and open heart. 

Reiki can help reduce physical pain, balance your energy system, increase mental clarity, enhance creativity, and facilitate personal healing and spiritual growth.

Please bring a childhood photo of yourself.


Following our meditation we will anchor this healing with 60 minutes of a Reiki share.
results.name: Healing The Inner Child Meditation and Reiki Share

results.description:
WOMEN ONLY EVENT. Meeting a MAN in NYC is not the easiest of tasks. What makes it even tougher is if you don't have a reliable friend to help navigate the NYC single scene. 

Come meet your new BFF at our Ladies Networking Night!

Every single woman needs a dependable friend, equally motivated to go out with you to parties, clubs, bars, and everything else a single women doesn't want to hit "solo." 

Meet up to 30 other fabulous women (20s & 30s) at our upscale speed networking event. Also, enjoy $4 beer and $5 wine drink specials. 

We'll start you off in groups where you'll get to meet 3-4 women at a time and then we'll transition to a less formal mixer where you all can mingle at your leisure. 

This is a PREPAY ONLY EVENT. NO tickets sold at the door.

1st 5 women to get tickets save $5 by using discount code "BFF" at checkout ($20). MUST BUY TICKET IN ADVANCE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/dates/Nov-04-2015_at_0730PM

Why does your RSVP say +30?  This is a multi-Meetup group event. This page only shows a small portion of the actual attendees. 30+ women will be attending. 

GET TICKETS HERE - https://dljparty.ticketleap.com/wing/dates/Nov-04-2015_at_0730PM
results.name: Ladies Networking Night / Meet Your New BFF (20s & 30s) PREPAY ONLY

As well as first aid and CPR, AED Certified. We incorporate all aspects of the trade as well as cardio and contact training. The time is now; get in on the act.

results.description:
TurnOn - yourself, your relationships, your sex. This is the place to excavate what you truly desire. Have you wondered how to create the relationships you want? Experience the intimacy you crave? Where you can say the honest truth to your partner, your family, your lover and yet stay grounded in yourself?

We believe that no matter what type of relationship you desire, human connection is at the basis of genuine relating. We play a set of intimate communication games that let you sharpen your relating skills and hone your attention. You get to shed off the layers that keep us from being seen, be vulnerable and feel more alive. We play 3 games (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). It's a refreshing change from the typical “Hi, how are you?” conversation. You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can work towards having the intimacy you want.

Come early, doors close at 8:10p. COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]

Can't make this one? Visit us at www.turnonny.us
https://youtu.be/8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
Come and join us for an evening of fun and TurnOn. How often do we get an opportunity to be real with each other in NYC?

We play 3 communication game (you can play at whatever level feels comfortable to you). Imagine meeting new people in an environment where people felt comfortable to be themselves. That's what we have created.

It's a refreshing change from the typical networking or bar conversation.

You get the opportunity to examine yourself. Through other people putting quality attention on you, asking questions with genuine curiosity, and then listening - really listening – to your responses.

What comes up might surprise you!

At the end of the evening we will tell you all about how you can learn the practice of Orgasmic Meditation. What class you can take and what we have to offer so you can have the life that you want.

It's amazing how connected we can end up feeling - even in a room full of strangers - when we are willing to say what's real. In an hour and some you may even forget for a moment you are in New York City.

OneTaste NYC is an organization teaches Orgasmic Meditation, otherwise known as OM. The games we play at TurnON are designed to create the visceral sensation of Orgasm/OM in your body, without having to actually do the practice (or remove any clothing!).

It's a friendly invitation to play and push your edges in a way that feels good. This allows you to stretch yourself and inspires self-discovery!

Come early, doors close at 8:10p.  

COST TO ATTEND IS $10.

For questions contact [masked] |[masked]


Can't make this one?  Visit us at www.turnonny.us

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=8OWkv9zms4E

results.description:
This fall, Warren Miller Entertainment will release its 66th snowsports film, Chasing Shadows. Watch JT Holmes, Seth Wescott, Caroline Gleich, Steven Nyman, and more as they pursue turns in Chamonix, Alaska’s Chugach, Utah’s Wasatch and the mightiest range of them all: the Himalaya. These athletes are masters in their element, and with every cliff drop, perfect line and knee-deep powder turn, they motivate us. Take a glimpse into the world of the U.S. freestyle team and see the dynamics of snowsports that live on the fringe, like monoskiing, powsurfing and speed riding. Explore what it means to be inspired, and what it is about exotic locations and snow-covered summits that keep us searching for more. Winter starts with Warren Miller.

To Purchase tickets: https://tickets.tarrytownmusichall.org/eventperformances.asp?evt=1715

https://youtu.be/WF1D3aML-3I
results.name: Warren Miller's film "Chasing Shadows" in Tarrytown

results.description:
Leadership and Lipstick

Ladies, this is one of my favorite signature classes that I offer as Woman's Coach and I'd love for you to join and receive the benefits.  It ties in concepts like what is leadership, why women make the best leaders and entrepreneurs, and what can you do TODAY to be an amazing leader in your life.

It's one of my favorite topics to discuss so please bring questions.  Please dress comfortably, make some tea/coffee, and put the kids to sleep.  This is guaranteed to be a great class!

Questions to ask yourself:

1.  What does leadership mean to you?

2.  How do you think women operate as leaders?

3.  How do you think being a woman has impacted your leadership skills?


What else?

Post class we can talk about how I can help you with any urgent questions/topics that come up in your life where you'd like to improve as a leader.
results.how_to_find_us: Postponed for a later date.
results.name: POSTPONED: Leadership and Lipstick Teleclass

East Coast Swing/Jitterbug with  Spencer Weisbond

This six week, progressive session:
Sept 30, 2015- Nov 4, 2015
Wed
8:30PM - 9:30PM

  101: Beginner   Learn cool moves to classic tunes! This progressive, basic swing dance class will teach the absolute beginner how to Jitterbug or what is now known as East Coast Swing. For young adults and above, this partner dance class will teach beginner moves in swing and the technique to execute them properly. The class will learn a routine over a six week period. No partner, experience, or TALENT required.

    

  Teacher: Spencer Weisbond please call me with questions about your level[masked]

  Register and pricing below:

  http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=634125407<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=625347764"></a>

Spencer has been dancing swing since 1998. He has studied Lindy hop extensively with 4 time world champion and 8 time American champion, Nathalie Gomes. Spencer had led the outreach program for Hop Swing And & Jump dance studios at local venues around NYC.
Spencer has had his own program in swing at the JCC in Manhattan for over 8 years, and also teaches privately. He has taught for Lincoln Center’s “Midsummer Night Swing” He currently organizes the New York City Swing Dance Meetup Group, which has over 3300 members, making it one of the most active swing dance clubs in the world. Spencer also co-founded the popular NYC dance  event “Swing Remix”. www.SwingRemix.com </a>

<a href="http://ebiz.jccmanhattan.org/personifyebusiness/Programs/ProgramDetail.aspx?pid=135408">

results.description:
We're heading to Silvana in Harlem for a night of free expression. Where are you on the hero journey's? What is your story? Tell us and the rest of the Harlem community through spoken word, a funny story, or a song. The Versey team will be there to capture some of the best moments of the night.

Media is being owned by fewer and fewer corporations, so here at Versey we're proud to support one of the few independent and truly local media -open mics. They are vital to a community by honing local talent and giving community members a platform for their art. 

Founded by Gregrian Vassell, a developer with a decade of experience in mobile development at Intel, Versey is a mobile app that allows you to record mini podcasts. Support one of the few black-owned startups and meet us for a verse or two. Also, when you record a verse on Versey and share it on social media you'll get a drink-on us!


So come through for a night of free expression and creative range!

results.description:
Come and have a great time enjoy a great workout with great people while potentially  getting a fantastic sunrise! :)  Check out the photos of prior sunrise hikes !!

Please adhere to the two golden rules!

 1) Hike Safe

2) Have Fun  :)

Please try to be the timely as the purpose of this hike is to catch the sunrise. If you are going to be late please leave a message on the meet up board.

Directions From NY Route 9D, look for Bob's Corner Store in Beacon. Turn east onto Howland Avenue. then immediately turn right into the parking area for Scenic Hudson's Mount Beacon Park.


Public Transportation: Metro-North Hudson Line to Beacon station -- walk uphill to trailhead

Trail info- We will be taking the steps from the Gateway park to the Red trail. The trail is 6 or 7 switchbacks up to the old casino with a very rewarding lookout point where you can see sweeping views of the Hudson River and surrounding area.

Distance: 4 miles round trip


The First 0.8 miles of this hike is hard, and very steep with 1000ft. elevation gain. Mount Beacon is the second highest point in the Hudson Highlands. Depending on the map, it may be called Mount Beacon or Beacon Mountain. The mountain consists of two peaks. The northern peak is 1531ft and has a series of radio antennas on its summit. The higher southern peak is 1610ft and has a lookout tower on its summit. On a clear morning we will see the NYC skyline lights from the summit as well as views of the town of Beacon and the majority of the Highlands (including Storm King, Breakneck Ridge, and little Sugarloaf).


You agree when you sign up for this group or any of the events that you have read and understand the below.


If you join us for a hike (or any other event), please understand that you are responsible for your own preparedness and well-being and will hold no one else liable in case of injury or mishap. You agree not to hold the Organizer, Assistant Organizers, or any other members responsible for any injuries, mishaps, or any other situation that may happen at a planned event. You are responsible to research the event, know the area, and bring the proper gear.
results.name: Beacon Fire Tower Morning Workout Hike   SUNRISE

results.description:
Positive Connections for Success is a more relaxed and personal networking group for business professionals looking to build relationships and grow their business through referrals.

We focus on:

• Networking: Building relationships and earning each others trust to become referral partners

• Education: Understanding your business and helping you articulate your business

• Leadership: Leaders of the round table philosophy, every member is a leader of this group


We follow a structured meeting agenda starting with networking to develop relationships, giving us time to talk and get to know each other while having a warm breakfast, followed by:

• One Minute Elevator Pitch

• Business Presentations with Q&A and feedback (we have a large screen & clicker/pointer available for powerpoint presentations)

• Brainstorming Session, Successes & Referrals to Help Each Others Businesses grow

• Lots of Fun in the Process

"We Refer Business Partners, Not Business Cards!"

This is a group with category/specialty specific members (only one member per category/speciality).
Please view our sponsors page or contact us to verify your industry, category and specialty, before attending a meeting so as to not be in conflict with a group member.

We meet every Thursday morning from 7:00 AM to 8:30 AM and welcome guests to come and experience the group and then apply to join.

Non-members/guests pay a $10 fee to attend, which includes a warm served breakfast of their choosing and we ask to please be prepared with a one minute elevator pitch presenting:

• who you are

• type of business

• who would be a good referral for you


Current positions that we are interviewing, to build relationships with and pass referrals to include:

• Attorney

• Mortgage Broker

• Realtor

• Electrician 

• Landscaper

• Limo or car service

• Painter

• Plumber

• And more...

Please contact us for information or if you have any questions.

We look forward to seeing you at our next meetup!
results.how_to_find_us: It's 7am, you'll see us!

results.description:
Panels and Presenters

Reading Terror: Representations and Resistance

Panels and Presenters (in order of schedule)

Welcome Panel on Thursday – “Constructing and Inhabiting the Spaces of Terror”:

 Matthew Armstrong (Independent Researcher) – “Reading the GWOT: The Relationship between the Global War on Terror and Global Literacy.”  Shaza Elsheshtawy (The New School for Social Research) – “Cairo’sAshwa’iyyat: Informal Settlement Formation & the (Discursive) Construction of Terror.”  Sally Sharif (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “The Aesthetics of Jihad: A Study of Videos Released by the Islamic State.”  Hamza Muhammad Iqbal (Habib University) – “Karachi and Terror.”

1A. Terror Today

 Peter M. Boudreau  (Tufts University) – “Touch Me in the Morning: Finding Community in Ron Athey’sDissociative Sparkle.”  Vincent Sallé (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “Can terror be funny?”  Anne-Gabrielle Roussel (Brown University) – “French government’s fight against terrorism: the websitestop-djihadisme.gouv.fr

1B. Turning Terror into Text

 Ruth Riftin (University of Virginia) – “The Transmission of Terror: How the Witnesses of the Saint-Bartholomew’s Day Massacre turn their horrific experiences into text.”  Noni Carter (Columbia University) – “Archiving Terror and the Slave Sublime: Marlon James’The Book of Night Womenand its contribution to the politics of remembering.”  Malte Fabian Rauch (The New School for Social Research) – “An Aesthetic of Remembrance: Representing Atrocity in the Novel.”  Dolores Resano (University of Barcelona) – “9/11, Hero-cops and Counter-discourse in Jess Walter’sThe Zero

1C.  Terror on the Stage

 James Rumsey-Merlan (Princeton University) – “Stage Fright.”  Enzo Vasquez Toral (Princeton University) – “Brazilian Theater under Dictatorship and the Shinning Path: Reading Brechtian Influences as Inspiration and Response to Terror in Theatrical Discourse.”  Maria-Cristina Necula (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “Raising the Iron Curtain: The Bucharest Opera Resistance.”

2A. Terror and the Body

 Rebeccah Leiby (Boston University) – “Sublime Terror and the Danger of Serenity.”  Daniela Jiménez (University of California, Los Angeles) – “‘Every Time a Corpse Enters the Picture…’: Gothic and Evitamania inSanta Evita.”

 Colin Burns (Fordham University) – “Performing the Body in Pain: Body Art in Don DeLillo’sFalling Man

2B.  Terror and Trauma

 Diviani Chaudhuri (SUNY Binghamton) – “Reading the Landscape of Terror in Partitioned Nations: India/Pakistan and Israel/Palestine.”  Kaitlyn Martin Fox (Boston University) – “Wstawàch: Reading Terror as Awakening to the Unclaimed Past in Primo Levi’s Survival in Auschwitz and The Reawakening” Laurel Billings (University of Michigan) – “9/11’s Queer Poetics: Radical Love and Everyday Loss W.H. Auden’s ‘September 1, 1939’ and Claudia Rankin’s ‘Don’t Let Me Be Lonely’.”

2C.  The Revolutionary Spirit of Terror

 Luis A. Lei (The New School for Social Research) – “Absolute Freedom and Revolutionary Terror in China.”  Yannleon Chen (University of Arizona) – “The Different Faces of Terror: Facets of Violence and Terror in the RAF and BRD.”  Nick Olson (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “TBD”

3A. Terror in Latin America

 Philip Johnson (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “Exceptional State to Caliphate: the Journey of a Symbol.”  Ruth Halvey (Princeton University) – “Countering Narco Theatricality: Photojournalism and the Corpse in Contemporary Mexico.”  Andrea Adhara Gaytán Cuesta (Rutgers University) – “De lamano peluda a la Santa Muerte: Zombies, Death, Bodies and collective fear in Mexican daily life.”

3B.  Existential Terror

 Zunaira Yousaf (Independent Researcher) – “Terror and the Self.”  Paula Libfeld (The New School for Social Research) – “Disrupting the Instant: Levinas and Ethical Representations of the Holocaust.”  Marc Rickenbach (The Graduate Center, CUNY) – “Tone-Deaf Subjects, Overhearing Noise: Robbe Grillet’s Jealousy and Heidegger’s Hebel.”

3C. Memorializing (Victims of) Terror

 Ruichuan Wu (University of Pennsylvania) – “Pyramid of Skulls (​

Jingguan

)​: Ritualizing Terror in Early Chinese Military Culture”  Senem Guler-Biyikli (University of Pittsburgh) – “Away From the National Memorials: Narrative and Form at the Local 9/11 Memorials.”  Anila Gill (New York University) – “

Reflecting Absence

: History, Memory, and Void in the 9/11 Memorial Museum.”
results.name: Reading Terror: Representations and Resistance

results.description:
Register for Webinar

Hello DataSift Meetup Members! It's been a while since we all got together for a drink. We're working on some great events in the next few months, but in the meantime we wanted to extend a special invitation to attend one of our worldwide webinars. Even if the time doesn't work for you, register and you'll get access to the recording once it's over.

At DataSift we're constantly looking for ways to help customers build better insights from data. We're increasingly looking to data science techniques to achieve this.

One area we're currently working on is moving beyond keywords when building filters and classifiers. If you're a member of DataSift FORUM you'll be aware that we recently released our Keyword Relationship Explorer tool. This tool was a first step towards our goal.

Join us for our first in a series of webinars for the DataSift FORUM where you will:

• Understand how we built the model that sits behind the tool

• Learn how you can build your own model from your own data

• See how we're looking to build the concept of similarity into our platform and how it will transform the way customers will filter and classify data

Register for Webinar
results.how_to_find_us: Online Webinar (register to view recording later)
results.name: Webinar: Applying Data Science to move beyond Keywords for Social Analytics

results.description:
The Tow Center for Digital Journalism is hosting Farai Chideya and Josh Begley of The Intercept, along with Columbia Journalism School's Marguerite Holloway for a Tow Tea on "Parsing Tech Talk."  The discussion will focus on tips and strategies for effectively reporting on science, medicine and technology - as well as how best to communicate these complex topics to a general audience.


RSVP Recommended  @  http://bit.ly/1WwoNGj


A little about the panelists: 

Josh Begley: Josh Begley is a data artist and web developer based in Brooklyn. He is currently a reseach editor at 'The Intercept'. He is the creator of Metadata+, an iPhone app that tracks U.S. drone strikes. His work has appeared in Wired, The New York Times, NPR, The Atlantic, The Guardian, New York Magazine, and at the New Museum of Contemporary Art.

Farai Chideya: Farai Chideya is a reporter, political and cultural analyst, and educator. Over the years she has worked in print, television, radio, and digital media; covered every Presidential election since 1996; and traveled to 26 countries and 48 states to report, learn, and explore.


Marguerite Holloway: Marguerite Holloway is an Associate Professor of Professional Practice and Director, Science & Environmental Journalism at Columbia University. She has written about science—including natural history, environmental issues, public health, physics, neuroscience and women in science—for publications including the New York Times, Discover, Natural History,Wired and Scientific American, where she was a long-time writer and editor.
results.name: Tow Tea: Parsing Tech Talk

She Did What?!
Stories of Success from Women in Tech & Media


It's not easy being at the top. This is especially true for women, who face different challenges than their male counterparts, but have fewer mentors and role models to look up to. To inspire the community and future generations of women in tech and media, we're bringing four women together to discuss their journeys. Join us on Thursday, November 5th, for a panel that will explore the stories of these influential women and give insight into their successes.

results.description:
Weather: Please check back here for any weather updates and/or cancellations.

Transit: 2 or 5 trains to E 174th St stop and short walk. 5 train runs express until 7PM from E 149th St-Third Ave to E 180th St. BX17, BX21 and BX11 within walking distance.

Ready? Play.
_____________________________________________________

What will we be doing at the Meetup?
We will be meeting at the tennis courts for some friendly rallying, doubles, and singles play*. This meetup is open to players at any skill level; from beginner to advanced.

*For those of you who are interested in singles play, please keep in mind that the ability to play singles predicates on the amount of members who have RSVPed as well as court availability at the meetup event's venue. We cannot guarantee singles play in every instance.

How long will the meetup be?
The time listed for the meetup event is when you can expect to the event host to be there. If you would like to arrive earlier or later than the start time listed, please leave a comment in the meetup event you plan to attend. This will give everyone in attendance a good representation of who is showing up at what time.

What will it be like?
Our group is very friendly and loosely organized to allow for a fun experience.

Upon arrival, our event host will announce which court they are on in the comments of the meetup event. If you have a smartphone, we strongly suggest that you download the Meetup app for iPhone or Android to make communication easier.

When you arrive at the courts, look for the event host listed or other members of the group playing on (or near) the courts listed. Use the photos of each host/member on the website as a frame of reference.


Introduce yourself. Let the host know your level of play and you will be assigned to a court immediately.

Do members need to bring anything?
All members must bring their own racquet. Unfortunately, we do not supply racquets.

All members are encouraged to bring a fresh can of new balls. You can always use a marker to mark your initials on your ball if you would like to keep them for future play. Please keep in mind that tennis balls only last a couple of days after taking them out of the can before they lose their bounce.

If you plan to donate to the group, you can leave your donation with the meetup event host or the head organizer, Frank, if he’s in attendance. All donations go towards the fees required to organize the meetup.

Who should come? Are newcomers welcome?
Our meetup event is open to all players whether they're an absolute beginner or an advanced player. Players will be matched up with others based on their skill level. Beginners will be given an opportunity to play with higher level players so they can gain more experience with higher consistency.

It is a high priority for our group to help beginners increase their skill and become better players. If you are reading this and are an absolute beginner, please don't be intimidated. We want you to join us and have fun.

What should a newcomer expect?
If you're new to the group, you'll learn very quickly that our community is extremely friendly. We have a colorful cast of characters from all walks of life who are ready and willing to have a good time.

Whether you're interested in easy-going rallying or competitive play, we can accommodate you.

Questions?
If you have any other questions, concerns, or comments; please send them to our head organizer, Frank Tirado via email.

This group isn't your typical 'networking' event:  Our focus is helping each other grow our businesses through mastermind/brainstorming.  We are building business through building relationships with each other, so we can help each other succeed.

Here is an example of a typical Mastermind:

5:30pm – Open mix and mingle (15 minutes)

5:45-6:30pm – Group business needs requests/Mastermind (45 minutes)

6:30-7:00pm – Connection exchange (30 minutes – or longer, as space availability allows)

It's a 'smallish' event with between 4-12 in attendance, so we have the time and environment to get to know each other.  Plus, it's relaxed and enjoyable, so join us!

Attendance costs $5 - you can pay here in Meetup when registering - or pay at the door.  We ask that you RSVP in advance, as we don't want to turn anyone away due to our space constraints.

Please take a moment to read "About us" at the top left so you get to know what we're all about before you RSVP.

results.description:
Meet the leaders of Axial, Fivver, PRIV and Handy - four exciting gig/shared economy start-ups you should get to know.  MIT Sloan Fellow Michael Schrage will facilitate a panel discussion on the hows and whys of making these business models succeed for customers, participants and investors alike.


What skills and talents win? What management cliches are doomed to obsolete anachronisms? What ways to measure, match and monetize human capital in these marketplaces work best? Is there a tad too much froth?

In market sectors from beauty and wellness to talent to enterprise support, the opportunities for ingenuity and impact appear rife. This panel examines how real they are.

Schedule


> 5:30 - 6:00 pm Registration and Networking
> 6:00 - 7:30 pm Panel Discussion and Q&A
> 7:30 - 8:30 pm Drinks and Networking

TO REGISTER, PLEASE GO TO OUR SITE AND REGISTER THROUGH EVENTBRITE:

http://mitefnyc.org/eventbrite-events/?event=18955840429


Moderator:


Michael Schrage
Research Fellow, MIT Center for Digital Business
Visiting Fellow, Imperial College Dept. of Innovation and Entrepreneurship
</a>

A fellow with the Massachusetts Institute of Technology (MIT) Sloan School's Initiative on the Digital Economy and a visiting scholar at Imperial College’s Innovation and Entrepreneurship program, Michael Schrage is author of <a href="http://www.amazon.com/Innovators-Hypothesis-Cheap-Experiments-Worth/dp/0262028360/ref=sr_1_1?ie=UTF8&qid=1443823185&sr=8-1&keywords=Michael+Schrage">’The Innovator’s Hypothesis’ [MIT Press 2014] and ‘Who Do You Want Your Customers To Become?’ [Harvard Business Review Press 2012]. His research, writing and advisory work focuses on the ‘behavioral economics’ of models, prototypes and experiments as collaborative media for managing ‘innovation risk.’ He describes this as ‘behavioral OR.’

His current research explores the role of two-sided markets and ’network effects’ in shaping innovation and human capital investment. He is an angel investor in several digital media and ‘machine learning’ start-ups. A featured and top trafficked blogger for the Harvard Business Review site, his work has been published the Sloan Management Review, the Financial Times, The Wall Street Journal, the Nikkei Asian Review, the CACM as well as peer-reviewed publications.

Panelists:

Umang Dua
Founder and COO at Handy
</a>

As Handy’s COO, Umang plays a pivotal role in increasing Handy’s footprint, both across North America and abroad, spearheading new market rollout and managing the company’s aggressive growth. From home cleaning to handyman services, Handy instantly matches thousands of customers every week with trusted professionals in cities all around the world. With a seamless 60-second booking process, secure payment, and a 100% money-back guarantee, Handy is the easiest, most convenient way to book home services.

While in college, Umang founded his first startup College Connect, an online platform that connected international college and business school applicants with enrolled students around the world. After college, Umang worked briefly at McKinsey & Company but soon left to study at Harvard Business School. It was there that Umang met his Handy co-founder, Oisin Hanrahan. In 2012, the two launched Handy as the on-demand platform for home services, connecting consumers with quality home service professionals.

Currently living in New York, Umang is passionate about global politics and an avid traveler.

David Manela
Chief Revenue Officer at Fiverr
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/david-manela/0/527/83b">

David Manela is the Chief Revenue Officer of Fiverr, the world’s largest marketplace for creative and professional services. As Fiverr’s CRO, he is responsible for driving Fiverr's aggressive growth, including acquisition, engagement, and category strategies across all Fiverr 150+ marketplace categories. Prior to Fiverr, David played a pivotal role at ideel, where he led the company’s marketing, merchandising, planning, and e-commerce functions. He helped grow the company from a startup to an online retailer of $130M+, earning recognition from Inc. magazine as “America’s Fastest Growing Private Company.” David earned his MBA in finance from Rouen Graduate School of Management and an MA in European history from the University of Rouen in France. He and his wife live in New York City with their two children.

Allison Tepley
SVP Marketing & Business Development at AXIAL.net
</a>

Axial, founded in 2009, provides a network of 20,000 CEOs, buyers, lenders, investors and advisors with the keys to run business development activities. Prior to Axial, Allison held senior marketing roles at Google, AOL and several start-ups prior to management consulting at BCG.  She graduated from Harvard Business School in 2005.

Joseph Terzi
Co-Founder/CEO at PRIV
<a href="https://www.linkedin.com/pub/joseph-terzi/8a/259/964">

Since 2010, Joseph has been developing iOS, Android, and web applications. He developed multiple hi tech apps for national luxury beauty brands, as well as innovative software solutions for the management and operations of dispatch-orientated service businesses that rely on fast, location based, peer-to-peer communication. Joseph still works closely with PRIV CTO in all matters relating to tech.

Joseph graduated from Columbia University in 2004. He has founded and run companies in diverse sectors including land development and fashion.

New York, NY 10038
