On November 5th, NYBC is holding its 50th anniversary fundraising gala at Cipriani, an exclusive event space in NYC. NYBC, which earned $500 million in royalties off of research conducted on the chimps, is expected to raise hundreds of thousands of dollars, if not more, at this gala. Please join us at a press conference and protest to remind NYBC of its promise to provide these chimps with lifelong care and to educate its corporate donors about the shocking scandal. Advocates: this is your opportunity to come to NYC and take a stand on behalf of the chimps abandoned by NYBC. Stay tuned for updates.

results.description:
Note: This is the opening reception of a new Exhibition at the Consulate General of the Federal Republic of Germany. This event is free of charge, but REGISTRATION AT EVENTBRITE is REQUIRED after your RSVP, or you may not get access to the event, even if you RSVP'd here.


After your RSVP here in the group, please proceed to

https://www.eventbrite.com/e/celia-rogge-exhibition-opening-tickets-18763903340


immediately to secure your spot.

Briefly about the artist

Celia Rogge has built a strong international reputation as a photographer over the past 10 years and has had her work exhibited extensively.

The Museum of the City of New York recently included her work (Calm After The Storm…) in the “Rising Waters 2.0” exhibition.

What to find at the Exhibition
At the General Consulate you will find a number of pieces included from her vibrant series New York Reflections. The reflections of New York architecture elevate the contours of this metropolis to another perceptive level. Before unseen ornamental structures are filtered through the transformative power of light. The London Reflections series here is represented by the images “St Pauls…”

Pieces from the Calliope series offer an entirely different projection of the transformative power of light through the use of infrared photography, which reflects daylight at a different frequency. Calliope, the photographer’s muse, is captured using this unusual type of photography - allowing for the viewer to transcend into an ethereal otherworldliness.

Other works included in this show at the General Consulate of Germany show her continued love of structure, architecture and reflective light. In the Palais Lichtenau Enfilades the viewer is enticed to step through the image into another world. And the pieces of her Sandy andRiverside series show the continued love of and fascination with the City of New York.

More about the artist
German born photographer Celia Rogge has lived and worked in New York since the mid-1990s but has also called Berlin, London, Washington and Montreux her home. She studied at the International Center of Photography (ICP) in Manhattan, Georgetown University’s School of Foreign Service and at the LSE in London.

In the United States she is represented by the renowned Galerie Mourlot in New York and in Germany by Galerie Friedmann Hahn in Berlin.


Ongoing Exhibit Hours (after the Opening Reception)

Thursday, November 5 – Friday, November 27, 2015

Hours: Mon-Fri 9:00am – 5:00pm

 (closed on weekends)
Admission is always free.

Official Site:

http://www.germany.info/Vertretung/usa/en/__events/GKs/NEWY/2015/11/08__Rogge.html?archive=2010496

How do I get there by subway?

Your best bet is the 6 Train to 51st Street, with more options form Grand Central Terminal (4/5/6/7), but since this is at 1st Ave and 49th, there is going to be a bit of a walk involved, keep that in mind for your timing.

I hope to see you there, please don't forget to register at Eventbrite (see link atop) for guaranteed access. And - as always - change your RSVP status if your plans change. We appreciate it very much!

Thomas

[masked]

[masked]

results.description:
Join DM Kyle Wagenblast as he recreates the classic D&D 2E module "Adam's Wrath" by Lisa Smedman. This is an adventure in the Ravenloft setting, updated to D&D 5E, and is for characters of 5th level.

In the domain of Lamordia, Doctor Victor Mordenheim created Adam, cobbling the creature together from parts of human corpses. Now, years later, Adam wants revenge. Adam wants Elise, Victor's wife. Adam wants Victor dead.

The players' ship founders on the coast of the domain of Lamordia. A vicious storm leaves them washed ashore, cold and hungry on the ice-bound Isle of Agony... then, the terror begins.

This is Part 1 of a series presentations focusing on on productivity around the Revit & BIM workflow. In the spring we will follow up with "Automate Your Workflow, Part 2: Advanced Tools for Productivity via the API"

The Speaker: Michael Coffey

Michael is a Digital Design Specialist at Gensler's New York office since 2011.  He is a licensed architect and LEED accredited professional and has worked on various projects in the New York City and New Jersey area.  He enjoys learning everything about Revit and making it work in more expeditious and rewarding ways.  For the past two years he has written over 50 add-in tools for Revit and manages a firmwide tool set for Gensler's 46 offices and a regional tool set for 7 offices.

For those new to the Hop you might be wondering how you will find the group. Well below is a lovely pictures of myself. Study my face carefully and commit it to memory. Now that I am burned into your hippocampus simply look for me hovering near the entrance to the first gallery.

Just a little more business...


Every week I receive emails from new members asking if there is a fee to join or attend the Thursday Night Gallery Hop. So rather than answer each email individually I'll kill a whole flock of birds with one stone.     


THE HOP IS, ALWAYS HAS BEEN, AND WILL REMAIN COMPLETELY FREE    


That said if you would like to help offset my organizer fees or buy me a post-hop bourbon you are more than welcome to click the 'chip in' button on the left side of this page. But let me reiterate contributions while appreciated are NOT required.

results.description:
All Bisexual, Non-monosexual, and all other Queer-identified and Bi-friendly people are invited to come join people from the greater NYC Area in a lively topic oriented discussion at BiRequest's famously open, non-judgmental, safe space. If you can't make it to the meeting, feel free to join everyone afterward around  "eight-fifteenish" for dinner.

about us: Thanks to the dedication and hard work of many good bisexual folk, BiRequest is a bisexual social discussion group serving the New York City metropolitan area since January 1994. We provide a safe space for bisexuals and bi-friendly people to gather and discuss issues of importance to us.

We're a co-ed group for adults from 18 to 80-plus who meet twice a month every 1st and 3rd Thursday evening at NYC's LGBT Center in the West Village. The meetings are moderated and focused on a discussion topic but not limited to that week's topic.

After the discussion group session, at 8 o'clock we go to dinner at a nearby, reasonably-priced restaurant for socializing and more informal discussion. We also have occasional social events such as movie nights, parties, and much more. Join us for a meeting or event and find the community you've been looking for!

People who can't make it to the meeting are invited to join our private online group BiRequest on Yahoo or on our Facebook Page BiRequest on Facebook.

results.description:
Who: Joel and Moshe will be the hosts of the meetup. Please find them if you need belay partners.


Where: Brooklyn Boulders 575 Degraw St, Brooklyn, NY 11217

When: We usually climb between 6pm and 9pm. There is no strict start time and the organizers try their best to be there around 5pm. If you are new, please feel free to warm up on an easy bouldering wall and find us later if you need a belay partner.

Transportation: By subway: Take the 2, 3, 4, 5, N, Q, R, B, or D to Atlantic-Pacific, transfer to the R for one stop to Union St. Walk 2 blocks north, turn left on Degraw, we are the last door on the right side of the street.

Cost/Discount: get a meetup discount if you sign up with our group which gives you $19 entrance + FREE gear rentals. You can bring your friends and they will get the same discount from us. Just mention "Rock & Ice" at the front desk in order to receive your discount and free rentals.

How to meet us: If you need a belay partner, come find the organizer(s). Come say hi even if you don't need a partner. Sometimes we grab drinks/food apres-climb.

Notice to beginners: if you have never ever climbed or belayed before you will need to take a class - it takes place every night at 7pm. There is a nominal fee for this. What to wear - comfortable clothes (think yoga).

Notice to newcomers: You need to pass a belay certification. If you had belayed before, the test takes couple of minutes. If you need a refresher, a test partner or belay partner, please see feel free to see me. I usually get to the gym around 6pm, and either boulder at the entrance wall or top-rope in the main room. I post a comment what I'm wearing that day the afternoon of.

Here is the link to BKB: </a><a target="_blank"><a target="_blank"></a><a target="_blank">http://www.brooklynboulders.com</a>;;

If you decide to stick with the sport, please peruse our message boards for good deals on climbing shoes and other gear.
results.how_to_find_us: hi, just ask at the front desk for location of rock & ice meetup group when checking in :)
results.name: Midweek Climbing at Brooklyn Boulders (Group Discount)

results.description:
JC Flexlife is hosting a donation-based bootcamp at Sacred Souls Yoga Studio!


 JC Flexlife offers a fitness program to create habits that will enable you to perform at an optimal level. The goal is to immerse you in activities that will help you realize your true physical and mental strength. Every workout will start with a warm up and end with a cool down. Exercises consist of push ups, planks, squats, crunches, and every variation in between. Normally, we incorporate the park's natural offerings (hills, stairs, curbs, benches, etc.) into the workout. However, during the winter months, we will focus on indoor exercises that do not require any special equipment. Modifications to exercises will also be provided to accommodate various fitness levels. At the end of the day, we're here to enjoy the earth, push limits, and have fun.

$10 suggested donation
results.name: Bootcamp with JC Flexlife

results.description:
This modern take on the classic American farmhouse sets fun, geometric volumes under a gabled roof. 

The house represents the family’s core commitment to sustainable living where food is grown in their organic garden, meals are created and shared together, and lessons in social and environmental responsibility are a part of everyday living. 

A cost-effective Larsen truss assembly, built on-site and stuffed with dense-pack cellulose, was essential in achieving the high level of performance and optimized comfort that the Passive House Standard delivers. 

Carefully taped OSB formed the interior air barrier, while a vapor-open housewrap was used on the exterior. Most of the glazing was put on the south-facing side to maximize solar gains, but about 20% was installed on the north-facing side to take advantage of the views in that direction, necessitating additional insulation in the roof and walls. 

While the main heat source will be the solar gain and occupants’ activities, any needed additional heating and cooling is being supplied through a ducted mini-split system. An energy-recovery ventilator (ERV) is supplying the fresh air. The large, triple-paned windows in the dining room, library, and stairwell invite generous amounts of light to bathe the common areas that are central gathering places for family life. Marble countertops take center stage in the kitchen while the trendy brass hardware adds warmth.
results.name: Tour NJ's 1st Certified Passive House!

group.name: NY Passive House (NYPH) Meetup: New York City

results.description:
A visit to the Museum of Chinese in America with FREE ADMISSION DAY meeting 6pm in front of the museum. 

Dinner in Chinatown after the museum visit.  Possibly good 'ol Cantonese food or Malaysian or Vietnamese?  We'll decide the night of.  Lobster fried rice anyone?  See photo below.

Founded in 1980, the Museum of Chinese in America (MOCA) is dedicated to preserving and presenting the history, heritage, culture and diverse experiences of people of Chinese descent in the United States.  The greatly expanded MOCA at 215 Centre Street is a national home for the precious narratives of diverse Chinese American communities, and strives to be a model among interactive museums.

The Museum promotes dialogue and understanding among people of all cultural backgrounds, bringing 160 years of Chinese American history to vivid life through its innovative exhibitions, educational and cultural programs. MOCA welcomes diverse visitors and participants to its broad array of exhibits and programs.  MOCA’s expansion accommodates its range of visitors which include: New Yorkers, domestic and international visitors, neighborhood residents, students and school groups from local and regional schools.

Current Exhibitions...  http://www.mocanyc.org/exhibitions/current/

Collections...   http://www.mocanyc.org/collections/


Possible dinner suggestion - Congee Bowery, 207 Bowery, New York, NY 10002 b/t Spring St & Rivington St with their unique LOBSTER FRIED RICE?

Hope to see everyone at this great opportunity to learn, experience, reflect, and support the Chinese community.


Cheers!

Will

Disclaimer:  http://www.meetup.com/NYCAsianMeetup/pages/Disclaimer
results.name: Museum of Chinese in America visit (Free Admission) & Dinner!

Together, they can be used to build functional and beautiful websites. Come be introduced to the wonderful world of HTML and CSS and get your hands on some introductory code! You'll leave with a basic web page created and a new understanding of the fundamentals of programming.

Sign up now to reserve a spot! This event is hosted by DevBootcamp, a bootcamp that has made over 1700 students full-stack web developers in just 19 weeks.

Come out and learn how to build websites from people that are paid to teach it.

As seen in the CNBC Documentary The Bitcoin Uprising.

Starting at 6:00 p.m. Bitcoin Center NYC welcomes Satoshi Square for a night of spontaneous Bitcoin trading in a LIVE open outcry trading pit. Buy or sell Bitcoins with Satoshi Square and others, or just observe and enjoy a party among fellow Bitcoin enthusiasts. Open bar!

This event is perfect for expert and novice traders as well as exhibitors, vendors, hardware and software developers, educators, students, media, and anyone wanting to be acquainted with the technology. Talk to our experts and get feedback concerning Bitcoin-related startups.

No matter the focus of your Bitcoin interest or your expertise level, you are welcome. Bring a friend who might have read or heard something about Bitcoin. With our assistance he or she will leave with a better understanding and their first electronic or paper wallet. 

All trading is organic, spontaneous, and occurs directly between sellers and buyers. There are no intermediaries, and no fees as we are neither a trading floor nor a brokerage. Drinks and hospitality are courtesy of Bitcoin Center NYC. 

Details follow. See you there!

Every Thursday Night

6:00 p.m. to 9:00 p.m.

25 Cleveland Place

Join the NJ LGBT Chamber on Thursday, November 5th, at one of New Jersey's premier cultural institutions, the Montclair Art Museum, for their November First Thursday Night event.  It's an evening of art & culture - and networking.

Museum admission is free.  Tour the MAM galleries from 5 to 9 p.m., to view their permanent collection and their current exhibitions, Illustrations and Literary Themes in American Art: Works from the Collection,  Eric Carle: Animals and Friends and Work and Leisure in American Art: Selected Works from the Collection.  And featured on MAM's outdoor video monitors is Peggy Ahwesh's video Warm Objects (pictured above).  "The video was produced in close collaboration with the engineering research center MIRTHE (Mid-InfraRed Technologies for Health and the Environment), an organization dedicated to the development of optical trace gas sensing systems."

The museum will be offering hourly gallery tours, live music and interactive entertainment.  There will also be a cash bar provided by one of Montclair's premier restaurants.  


From 6pm to 9pm the LGBT Chamber of Commerce's board of directors will be there networking and helping you to make the business and social connections you need.  Just look for our table in the museum's rotunda.

Parking is ample in the museum's parking lot and all adjacent streets.

Carefully taped OSB formed the interior air barrier, while a vapor-open housewrap was used on the exterior. Most of the glazing was put on the south-facing side to maximize solar gains, but about 20% was installed on the north-facing side to take advantage of the views in that direction, necessitating additional insulation in the roof and walls. 

While the main heat source will be the solar gain and occupants’ activities, any needed additional heating and cooling is being supplied through a ducted mini-split system. An energy-recovery ventilator (ERV) is supplying the fresh air. The large, triple-paned windows in the dining room, library, and stairwell invite generous amounts of light to bathe the common areas that are central gathering places for family life. Marble countertops take center stage in the kitchen while the trendy brass hardware adds warmth.

results.description:
Would you like to -

• Become a more confident public speaker?

•Feel more at-ease during business meetings and social occasions?

•Make new friends, in a supportive and encouraging environment?

The friendly people at Pride Toastmasters would love to help you improve your public speaking skills, as you boost your leadership and self confidence skills! We focus on making our guests very welcome. We meet every Thursday from 6:15 p.m. until 7:25 at the LGBT Center, 208 W 13th St, New York, NY 10011. If you arrive early, expect to be warmly greeted and given an overview of what to expect during the fun, informative and engaging meeting! 

By the way, there’s nothing for you to prepare in advance of our meeting, no fee to pay as our guest and no pressure to join.  Please do visit and sample this exciting option for personal and professional growth!

An average of 20 members and guests attend each Pride Toastmasters meeting. Since most aren't members of Meetup, the attendance figures shown here are always much lower.

Please visit our web site at http://www.PrideToastmasters.com

results.description:
STSANY welcomes NEW MEMBERS, FIRST-TIMERS, Pros, Non-Pros, Semi-Pros and invited GUESTS to this workshop on Thursday, November 5 and all those in the future-TBA. 

Meetup Fees: Members: $20; Participating Guests; $15; Observers: $10. Policy: Exact amount in cash at the door.

Please arrive 10 minutes prior to the meetup, if possible, as elevators are busy at that hour.

 ***RSVP DEADLINE is 10:00 p.m. on Wednesday, November 4 for this November 5 meetup. You MUST RSVP on the posting page, and DOUBLE-CONFIRM by November 4, even if you already RSVPd. If you miss the deadline and would like to attend, please send me an email and include your email address and phone number. I will respond!

***ATTENTION "Looking for Christmas" HOLIDAY EVENT VOLUNTEERS: Be sure to bring your written songs, poems, stories and what you will say to the audience to all workshops, so I can put the program together, in writing. You must attend this workshop and others during November and December to work on your material. 

IMPORTANT: ATTENTION New Holiday Volunteers: Spots are still open for our December 17 and 27 events. You must contact me IMMEDIATELY if you wish to volunteer, AND attend at least two workshops in November to be considered for one or both of these two events. We will present some solos and group numbers as part of our holiday programs.

***IMPORTANT NEW POLICY: YOU MUST DOUBLE CONFIRM YOUR "YES" RSVP or change it by one day prior to any meetup to avoid no-shows or last minute cancellations, even it you have already RSVPd before the deadline. It takes time and effort to schedule a meetup, SO PLEASE BE CONSIDERATE by adhering to this policy. Thank you!

All workshops benefit members who want to improve their vocal, acting  and instrumental technique and interpretation. They provide a safe, supportive, AFFORDABLE, enjoyable atmosphere which addresses self-confidence, stage fright and other matters important to our members. Workshops are a first step in providing performance and volunteer opportunities.

MEETUPS serve several purposes: 

* Learning: You are given instruction in singing and acting technique and interpretation, and you also learn from watching and listening to others. 

* Networking: You are encouraged to exchange information with other members (before, at a break and after the meetup) with whom you feel an affinity, personally and/or performance-wise, and to possibly collaborate with them on  STSANY projects or outside the meetup;

* Volunteering: Please volunteer to be an assistant organizer (talk to me about your special talents!), and to help out at our various events;

* Social: Enjoy meeting and getting to know others either before, during a break, or after meetup is over.

IMPORTANT! Although I ALWAYS send updates, if necessary, be sure to keep checking the postings for meetups and your emails about the day and time of each meetup. Weather conditions, illness and unforeseen events can cause cancellations. 

What to bring to all meetup workshops: (Please read, carefully!) 

 Singers: Bring 2 contrasting songs of any style (entire sheet music) - 2 copies, please. If you don't have written songs, let me know and I can provide some at the meetup.

NOTE! If you don't wish to sing solo, please join us in our group numbers. Getting started is the important thing.  The shyness will subside, little by little.

Actors: Bring 2 contrasting monologues, poems or recitations - 2 copies, please.

Instrumentalists: Be prepared to play one or two contrasting pieces of any style.

YOU ARE ENCOURAGED TO RECORD the meetups for continued learning and inspiration!

NOTE: PRIVATE LESSONS are offered from 11:00 a.m to 8:00 p.m., by appointment, on weekdays/nights, and on Saturdays (sometimes Sundays) from 10:00 a.m.-1:00 p.m. Member discount cost: $65 for 45 minutes. Some further discounts may be available. Read your emails. RSVP on each posting, separately, for lessons and kindly adhere to all the details.

NOTE: TO read about STSANY's GOALS and reviews, click on pages: http://www.meetup.com/SOMETHING-TO-SING-ABOUT-IN-NEW-YORK/about/

To see and hear members perform, please VISIT and SUBSCRIBE TO our youtube channel by clicking on this link: https://www.youtube.com/user/AlmaMusica/videos?view_as=public

Be inspired and live your DREAMS! Carpe diem!

All the best,

Anna Bartos

www.annabartos.com

Founder-Director, STSANY since 2010

Founder-Director, Flor y Canto Chamber Ensemble since 1998

NYU Vocal Faculty from[masked] 

REVIEWS by STSANY members, fellow performers and audience members: 

Anna Bartos is not only a superb singing teacher (she knows her music), she is an equally excellent coach, which is a rarity among singing teachers. She is also capable of imparting manyhelpful nuggets of information about the process of singing and performing that one doesn't usually receive from one's teacher. I found her instruction of enormous value.___. P. Vincent, NYC actor, playwright and STSANY showcase performer.

It was a wonderful session w/a warm, knowledgeable & insightful instructor & in great company!____Allyson, Member, STSANY

Great session; good, helpful feedback; supportive.____Barbara, Member, STSANY

“ Fortunately for me I had the pleasure of Anna helping me with my singing technique which is something that I have always to do. I am looking forward to more meetups and meeting new people. You should all attend this meetup whether you are experienced or a beginner (like me). You will be able to discover something so unique and wonderful about yourself with this group. I can guarantee it! ”______Chels, Members, STSANY

An excellent meetup! Anna knows her stuff and helped me improve my performances; the other members/performers are talented and friendly and fun."____Glen, Member, STSANY

The MUSICALE was a wonderfully diverse program in an intimate setting. I found the preliminary workshops extremely helpful in putting a role I'd worked on (for longer than I'd like to say) into a historical, musical, and linguistic framework. I am eager to do more! Anna Bartos is knowledgeable about a broad range of musical styles and genres, acting and character development as well as singing. I would definitely like to perform in this type of event again. For me, once a season would be good (3-4 times a year)."____Rebecca, Member of STSANY (Musicale on 1/19/14)

Amazing event. Thank you, Anna for holding the musicale. I am also glad to meet new singers.___Saadat, Member of STSANY

What a delightful surprise! One often doesn't know what to expect of a showcase! Congratulations to Anna, a real pro, and an impressive mentor to a diverse array of talent. The 'meet-up' seems to be a real resource for both the performers and those of us in the audience.  Keep up the good work!____Mary Jay, Seasoned Senior Performer

It was a privilege to work with Anna Bartos on this 9/11 memorial concert. All of the performers were of high caliber and the audience rewarded our efforts with heartfelt applause. The program, with its mixture of styles and its emphasis on Americana, was just perfect for the anniversary date. I had a great time yesterday. It was a meaningful and well-organized concert.___ Moshe Knoll, Classical pianist.

Thank you so much for inviting us to perform on this wonderful 9/11 concert.___Rosa Hyewon, Classical Guitarist

results.description:
Graybar Toastmasters is open to all who wish to improve their public speaking and leadership skills. In addition, this is a great way to network with a dynamic and diverse group of professionals.

Founded in 1954, we are one of the oldest Toastmasters clubs in New York City. We are a friendly club with members dedicated to helping each other become better speakers.

We meet from 6:15pm to 8:15pm on the 1st and 3rd Thursdays of each month in the same location. 

Our meetings are structured to allow everbody participate, practice and learn.

In our meetings the members of the club take different roles that allow them to practice and improve their public speaking and leadership skills by completing different projects.

The different roles include giving prepared presentations, chairing the meeting, improvising a short speech, telling a joke, giving feedback to speakers, evaluating the whole meeting, among others, all in a very friendly and supportive environment.

People who RSVP this meetup attend as guests. They introduce themselves at the beginning of the meeting and give feedback at the end, and some of them may participate in an improv exercise, this is an opportunity for you to check out the club coming to one or a couple of meetings, and decide if you want to join as an active member. 

To learn more about Toastmasters International please visit http://www.toastmasters.org/

See you there!
results.how_to_find_us: 28 East 35th Street, between Park and Madison in New York City. To enter, please press buzzer #2 outside the red door for the Gallery/Lounge on the 1st Floor. PLEASE attend the meeting only if you RSVP since the space available is limited.

results.description:
Landlord Tenant Litigation Workshop with Mr. Michael Mantell, Real Estate Dispute and Landlord Tenant Attorney 

Door Fee: $25 | Early Bird Fee: $15.00 

Register: bzhive.com/nov5NYC

------------------------------- 

New York City landlord/tenant law grows more complex each year. With each new case and judicial opinion, it only becomes more important to get advised by an experienced attorney who knows the New York State court system precisely.

Presenter: Michael Mantell

Michael Mantell is a 1969 graduate of St. John's University School of Law. For over 40 years, his law practice has focused on civil litigation

Michael has helped clients to create effective solutions for their legal problems. He has represented thousands of clients and tried hundreds of cases including over 50 jury trials. He has argued numerous appeals including arguments to the Court of Appeals, the highest state court in New York. Several of his victories have made the cover of the New York Law Journal.

Michael successfully runs his own legal practice and specifically focuses on landlord and tenant law, partnership and business litigation and real estate disputes.

Join us for the WORKSHOP to learn or to ask questions about:

• Residential eviction/summary proceedings for possession

• Breach of lease

• Cancellation or renewal of lease or lease options

• Residential lease disputes

• Sublease disputes and rent control problems

• Eviction notices

• Non-primary residence litigation

• Landlord occupancy, etc.

Michael Mantell may also answer your questions regarding your rights as a Landlord or your rights as a Tenant.

Agenda:

6:30 PM EST– Registration

7:00 PM EST – Workshop begins

8:00 PM EST – Q&A session with the presenter

results.description:
Learn more about human trafficking here: FightSlaveryNow.Org

 Special Event:
Ozark Henry Benefit Concert to fight human trafficking

Limited seating almost at capacity! Act promptly if interested.Amazing venue if you have not previously visited.

This is a benefit with a 'suggested donation' of $20, or whatever you can afford.

Multi-platinum artist Ozark Henry was just appointed as the United Nations' Belgium Goodwill Ambassador against human trafficking. Using his popularity to bring increased visibility in the fight against this modern form of slavery, he is performing a benefit concert and Q&A at the Morgan Library (NYC) on Nov. 5th, in partnership with the Blue Heart Campaign and the UN Trust Fund for Victims of Human Trafficking.


If you would like to go, please RSVP to Michael Alexander at:  [masked]

www.ozarkhenry.com
www.facebook.com/ozarkhenryofficial
www.twitter.com/ozarkhenry


Schedule
6:30 PM Doors open
7:00 PM Q & A with Ozark Henry, Geert De Proost (Flanders House) and intro UNODC & Blue Heart Campaign (trust fund victims human trafficking). Simone Monasebian, director of UNOCD New York and Bénédicte Frankinet (Belgian Ambassador in New York)
7:30 PM Concert
8:30 PM Reception
9:15 PM End

​ “Every time I visit Brussels by car, I notice them, young kids begging at traffic lights, systematically. Kids who were dropped off and later picked up by a van. Do you ever wonder: Who are these kids? Whose kids are they? Who takes care of them? Shouldn’t they be at school? Who’s making them do this? How come no one is stopping this? And if we do wonder, we don’t get involved, and then go on with our own lives, rocking in the free world. Human trafficking is a hidden crime, but we’ve all witnessed it. And when we don't stand up for the victims, the perpetrator doesn't get penalized." - Ozark Henry

For background, please visit our page on 'Street Children'.
results.name: Special Free Event: Ozark Henry, Anti-Trafficking Benefit, 11/5

results.description:
Overview:

“Brand” Everyone talks about it, very few really understand what it means. Here’s a secret…your brand is not your logo, it’s not your color scheme, or even your beautifully designed website... Brand is something much much more…

Join us on November 5th at the Wix Lounge for a hosted panel of brand and branding experts as we discuss what “Brand” really is, and how to shape, build and even defend your unique brand identity. 

About the Panel:

About the Venue:


Thank you to our partner Wix.com for hosting us at the Wix Lounge. Wix.com enables you to build a free and professional online presence, just the way you want it. With an HTML5 drag-and-drop website editor, 100s of web apps, designer-made templates, and tons of features, Wix gives you the tools to launch and manage your online presence.

So what are you waiting for? Sign up for a free Wix workshop today!
results.name: Beyond the Logo... defining, shaping and building your brand

results.description:
We have short notice for this month's meetup because our speaker only has one day in New York and he has decided to spend it with us.  

About the talk:


I will demonstrate open source work I have done which makes it easy to access and map US Census Data in R. That work has resulted in several R packages, including the popular package choroplethr.


About Ari:

Ari Lamstein is a software engineer and data analyst in San Francisco, California. He has over 10 years experience working at startups and large companies in San Francisco. He recently created his own consulting company, Lamstein Consulting LLC.

Thank you to Collective for hosting us.

Space is limited so we are going to close RSVPs the day before and we will need your full name for security.  So please include that with your registration.

Pizza starts at 6:30, the talk begins at 7 and then we'll go to a local bar.

results.description:
THIS IS A PAID EVENT. PLEASE PURCHASE YOUR TICKET HERE.

Shaun Johnson, Startup Institute

Shaun Johnson is a technologist, early adopter and helper of people. He is the co-founder of Startup Institute, an edtech company equipping individuals with the skills, access and mindset needed to make an immediate and positive impact on the startup venture they join.

Previously, Shaun was an Associate at TechStars, the premier startup accelerator providing seed stage investment and mentorship. Before that, Shaun was a management consultant in Booz Allen Hamilton’s Strategic Technology & Innovation practice.

He has advised companies across the emerging technology landscape, including smart grid energy, healthcare IT, broadband infrastructure & alternative assets. Prior to Booz Allen, Shaun managed metadata and econometrics as a Program Analyst at the Bureau of Labor Statistics. Still a lover of sexy consumer web products, Shaun has also helped numerous startups with product roadmapping, getting off the ground and taking market share.

Shaun holds a B.A. in computer science & sociology from Georgetown University and an M.S. in information systems from The Johns Hopkins University.

Agenda

6:30 Networking and Food
7:00 Fireside Chat
8:00 Networking

Hosted By Peter Crysdale, New York City Chapter Director

Peter is the Founder/CEO of StrategyHack, running marketing strategy hackathons for startups and professional marketers. He has a diverse background with 8+ years experience spanning engineering, social good and technology startups. In his spare time, he enjoys day dreaming and cross country skiing.  
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @PCrysdale

Hosted By Joshua Ness, Director of Marketing & Operations

Josh is a growth strategist in the New York City startup community. He used to produce global events for the likes of Microsoft. Now he helps marketing teams learn to think like startups.
Email: [masked] | Twitter: @jcness


Global Partners

</a> Google is committed to empowering entrepreneurs around the world through programs, partnerships, and our products.

Local Partners

<a href="http://pivotal.io/labs"> Pivotal Labs consists of fellow practitioners and startup veterans who have a history of solving problems with early stage companies.

</a> <a href="http://www.strategyhack.org">StrategyHack teaches marketers to be leaders in problem-solving and strategy development through a live-action, hands-on workshop with real startups.

</a> <a href="http://www.justworks.com/?utm_source=Startup%20Grind&utm_medium=Startup%20Grind%20--%20July%2C%20August%2C%20and%20September%20Events&utm_campaign=Startup%20Grind%20-%20July%2C%20Aug%2C%20Sept%20Event">Justworks frees entrepreneurs to focus on their business and their team. Its simple platform automates HR, payments, benefits, and government paperwork while saving companies up to 30% on healthcare. Headquartered in New York City, Justworks is funded by Bain Capital Ventures, Thrive Capital and Index Ventures. Learn more at Justworks.com.

Upcoming events you should attend!

</a> New Haven hosts <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/18970540397">Barry Nalebuff Honest Tea, Yale 10th of November 2015

</a> New York City hosts <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/18786105748">Ulrich Quay BMW i Ventures 2nd of December 2015

</a> New Haven hosts <a href="http://www.eventbrite.com/event/18983665655">Mahbod Moghadam Rap Genius, Everipedia 8th of December 2015

What is Startup Grind?

Startup Grind is a global startup community designed to educate, inspire, and connect entrepreneurs. We host monthly events in more than 150 cities and 65 countries featuring successful local founders, innovators, educators and investors who share personal stories and lessons learned on the road to building great companies. Our monthly fireside chat interviews, startup mixers and annual conferences provide ample opportunities to connect with amazing startups and the people behind them, tap into a strong support network, form meaningful connections and gain inspiration for the startup journey ahead. For more information visit StartupGrind.com or follow us on twitter @StartupGrind.

results.description:
This is an opportunity to practice Japanese conversation, and discuss and study the grammar, particles, Kanji, and culture. The topic varies among all these, according to what people are interested in talking about and the natural flow of conversation.

Members of all levels are welcome, from absolute beginners on up, and there is never a prerequisite. Native speakers are also encouraged to attend, both to lend their expertise and to receive the benefit of a look at the structure of Japanese from an outside linguistic perspective.

Here's a photo of the area where we meet, for reference:

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

 

The meeting is free, with no membership dues, hourly costs, or other expenses.

 

==> Learning & Practice RESOURCES

Various materials http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/thread/3199165/0#[masked]

KANJI http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1175397
KATAKANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198386
HIRAGANA http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/forum/1198387

Please click over DISCUSSIONS ->Message Board, then select your favorite topic. Have a lot of FUN learning about Nihon & Nihongo! http://www.meetup.com/Japanese-Culture/messages/boards/
results.how_to_find_us: Look for me, with the pile of Japanese dictionaries at one of the tables in the Atrium, or one of the other groups speaking in and about Japanese.
results.name: Weekly Japanese Study Group

results.description:
**You must rsvp through www.beginnerprogrammers.nyc (MANDATORY)**

If you did not sign up for the class through the website, you will not be able to attend!


Description


Learn why Version Control is cool, and how to kick ass in Git!

Topics Covered

• Setting up a git repository

• Git basics [git status, add, commit, push, pull]

• Git intermediate [managing your local & remote commits, reset, cherry-pick,]

Requirements

• Please be sure to have Git installed prior to class

• A laptop with a code editor of your choice installed.  We’ll be using Sublime Text.

• A basic understanding of how computers work

• No previous programming experience required
results.name: Using Git & the power of Version Control

Fortune Magazine projects that between 2006 and[masked],000 Millionaires will be Created through Real Estate Investing because of the recession. It is our Mission to bring that prediction to Fruition. Will you be one of those Millionaires?

######For the MEETING ADDRESS you MUST RSVP with your FULL NAME, EMAIL ADDRESS, and BEST PHONE #.

We offer Free Meetings, and Real Estate Investing Training CLASSES that cost, and have helped people transition from Wanting to invest, to BECOMING Real Estate Investors. From an investor that is only making a little extra money and still working for someone else, to a SUCCESSFUL Real Estate Investor who is in charge of how much he or she makes and has the option to never work for anyone else ever again. Gain a team of Investors, Real Estate Agents, Tax & Legal Professionals, Contractors and more, to really get your Business Started!

On THURSDAY we will discuss:

•  Our Recent Deals, and the steps we took to Complete them

•  Tax Write Offs and Creative Ways to Acquire Properties

•  Wholesaling, Fix and Flips, Buy and Holds, and more

We will:

•  Help you figure out how many properties You Personally Need to Acquire to Reach your Financial Goal

•  Discuss how you can be apart of our future Deals

results.description:
Do you want to learn how to take professional portraits? Do you want take home a studio quality portrait of you? In just two hours, you will learn tips on how to light faces and direct your models to pose in various assignment situations. 


This is a simple, no-nonsense but hands-on workshop where you get to shoot a series of professional-quality headshots for your own portfolio. Provided by exhibiting photographer Rebecca MB Pearson and NYU Photography Professor, John Hart.

Use any camera with a zoom capability of at least 85 mm. Although DSLRs are preferred, you can use a point-and-shoot camera. Beginners are welcome, however, we recommend that you have a thorough understanding of how your camera works, particularly manual settings for aperture and shutter priorities.

Syllabus

1.  Introduction to the course.

2.  Short presentation on portrait examples.  Discussing lighting, posing and directing situations. 

3.   Lighting set up.

4.  Live shooting.

5.  Critiquing.
results.name: How to Shoot a Studio Quality Portrait on a Budget

A “prompt” is a writing exercise with a specific theme and a time limit. These small exercises get writers to move away from their comfort zone and try a new genre, voice or character. Inspiration can be drawn from unlikely places and time limits lead to creativity.

Social Painting Night: Paint, Socialize, Make New Friends! (Must Pre-Pay Online)

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

WHERE: Social Bar & Lounge (795 8th Ave, New York, NY - At 48th St.)
WHEN: Friday, November 6th 2015: 6:30 PM - 9:00 PM So what's this event all about? Come on out and sip cocktails, mingle and paint a great canvas under the guidance of a master artist! During the 2 and a half hour event, you'll be crafting your masterpiece while sipping drinks that are available at the cash bar. We supply paint and brushes, canvases, easels, and aprons. Halfway through the class we take a 20 minute break to mingle a bit while having a few cocktails. We have a fun little ice breaker game that helps everyone get to meet each other where you'll get raffle tickets for a chance to win a prize! Our icebreaker is free flowing and fun (not rigid or overly structured).

This event is for singles but we don't gender balance it... meaning that sometimes we have more of one gender at the event. You'll have a great night out meeting like-minded fun new friends (Wing men/women to do other fun things with and who knows, you may even end up meeting that special someone). Typically about 75% of attendees of this event come alone and 25% bring friends. Singles ages 20s, 30s & 40s are welcome to attend.

There is a 1 drink minimum at this event. If you don't drink alcohol you are welcome to order juice/soda or something off the food/appetizer menu.

Oh - here's a quick note to the men. Guys... this event has been called, "A secret gem. One of the best places to meet fun, quality women in NYC". So fellas, if you really want to meet a great woman, ditch the online dating scene and head on out to one of our painting nights!

* This is a multi-Meetup group event. Over 10 Meetup groups have been invited to attend.

TICKET PRICE: $39
Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

PICS FROM RECENT EVENTS:

Get your tickets at: http://www.ClickMixers.com/socialpainting.html

Every business always has a few choices in how it is going to make money. How do you know which one is the best for you?

In this Workshop we will review different types of business models and their pros and cons.

The following business models will be covered:

• Manufacturing / Creator 

• Merchant / Distributor 

• Data 

• Advertiser 

•  Brokerage

•  Commission

We will then discuss a framework you can use to figure out how to choose the right business model for you, how to think about complementary revenue streams as well as the pricing strategy.

We will finish by reviewing your business model and each of you will get my personal feedback.

Please send a payment of $25 via paypal to [masked] by November 4th. Same day or at the door price is $30.

About Victoria Yampolsky, CFA:

Victoria Yampolsky, CFA, is the President of the Startup Station, a finance & strategy consultancy for startups and small/mid-size businesses. She is also an advisor to Mobilosophy, Divvy Tools, and Plan to Start, as well as founder of several ventures in media & entertainment. We're supporting several different lesson plans to allow for all experience levels. No Node.js experience is required.

Bring: An ID to show security and your laptop 

Prepare: 

Install Node.js before arriving. We'll certainly be available to help get Node.js installed if you're having issues, but coming prepared will mean more time for coding!

Lesson Plan:

For this NodeSchool, you will have several lesson plans to choose from. Choose one lesson.

INTRO TRACK (supported at every event): 

• JavaScripting

• LearnYouNode


IMMERSIVE TRACK: ES6 (new track updated monthly): 

• Count to 6

• ES Next Generation

• Learn Generators

Attracting 115 million consumers across its industry-leading print, digital, and video brands, the company’s portfolio includes some of the most iconic titles in media: Vogue, Vanity Fair, Glamour, Brides, Self, GQ, The New Yorker, Condé Nast Traveler, Details, Allure, Architectural Digest, Bon Appétit, Epicurious, Wired, W, Golf Digest, Golf World, Teen Vogue, Ars Technica, and Style.com. Event Description


“Brand” Everyone talks about it, very few really understand what it means. Here’s a secret…your brand is not your logo, it’s not your color scheme, or even your beautifully designed website... Brand is something much much more…

Join us on November 5th at the Wix Lounge for a hosted panel of brand and branding experts as we discuss what “Brand” really is, and how to shape, build and even defend your unique brand identity.

results.description:
This is a free group for anyone who enjoys playing board games and would like to make new friends while doing so. No previous knowledge of board games is necessary. We're happy to help newcomers along with how to play, as well as how to plan strategies to win the games.  

Our event is every Thursday night at Dave & Buster's in Westbury Long Island from 6:30pm to 10:30pm.  You can leave prior to 10:30pm if you want, also please note that Dave & Buster's closes at Midnight for those who want to stay later. 

This group meets in the Large Dining Room at the table directly in front of the wall with 9 Big Screen TV's.   We are 1 room over from the pool tables.  There is no cover charge to enter Dave & Buster's and plenty of parking is available. Also, there is no fee to join this meetup group. All that management at Dave & Buster's asks is that each person purchase $5 off their menu (it can be 1 appetizer, or 1 dessert, or a few sodas, basically whatever you choose).  

Plenty of board games will be present at this event, but feel free to bring some of your favorites. Some of the games that we play are Five Tribes, Kingsburg, Istanbul, Catan, Pirate's Cove, Ticket to Ride, Carcassonne, Stone Age, Suburbia, Castles of Mad King Ludwig, Love Letter Batman, Lords of Waterdeep, Splendor, The Cave, and more.  

Looking forward to meeting you. 

Mark

New York Tarot Tarotology is a class devoted to the study of the pictorial language of the Tarot. Have you ever wondered "What do the cards mean?" Or, "Why does every book you've looked at say the cards mean something else?" This class will answer both those questions. 

The on-going classes, will feature Tarot Symbolism, the Esoteric Titles assigned to each card in the Tarot as well as what each title means, Astrology and the Tarot, Qabalah and the Tarot, which includes a study of the Tree of Life,  Alchemy and the Tarot, as well as the History of the Tarot. 

All levels are welcome, even if this is your very first class.

There will be a Meet-Up sign on the table.

Payment can be made in class.

results.description:
Landlord Tenant Litigation Workshop with Mr. Michael Mantell, Real Estate Dispute and Landlord Tenant Attorney 

Door Fee: $25 | Early Bird Fee: $15.00 

Register: bzhive.com/nov5NYC

<a href="http://bzhive.com/LandTrustNYC"></a>

------------------------------- 

New York City landlord/tenant law grows more complex each year. With each new case and judicial opinion, it only becomes more important to get advised by an experienced attorney who knows the New York State court system precisely.

Presenter: Michael Mantell

Michael Mantell is a 1969 graduate of St. John's University School of Law. For over 40 years, his law practice has focused on civil litigation

Michael has helped clients to create effective solutions for their legal problems. He has represented thousands of clients and tried hundreds of cases including over 50 jury trials. He has argued numerous appeals including arguments to the Court of Appeals, the highest state court in New York. Several of his victories have made the cover of the New York Law Journal.

Michael successfully runs his own legal practice and specifically focuses on landlord and tenant law, partnership and business litigation and real estate disputes.

Join us for the WORKSHOP to learn or to ask questions about:

• Residential eviction/summary proceedings for possession

• Breach of lease

• Cancellation or renewal of lease or lease options

• Residential lease disputes

• Sublease disputes and rent control problems

• Eviction notices

• Non-primary residence litigation

• Landlord occupancy, etc.

Michael Mantell may also answer your questions regarding your rights as a Landlord or your rights as a Tenant.

Agenda:

6:30 PM EST– Registration

7:00 PM EST – Workshop begins

8:00 PM EST – Q&A session with the presenter

results.description: Hey there fellow thespians! Are you committed (like me), to getting hired as an actor? One of the essential tools we need to keep sharp is: great monologues. To keep our monologues fresh and kick-ass, I'm creating this meetup so we can practice with each other and be ready when opportunity knocks. Everyone will have a chance to perform at least one (two minute) monologue. Then, your peers (us) will give you feedback / suggested adjustments. Take 'em or leave 'em. Then you perform it again. Depending on turnout, we may each do this again with a second monologue. Unless someone has access to free professional space, I will rent space at one of the NY rehearsal studios - in which case, there'll be a small fee to cover the rental space (divide cost of space by number of attendees). So - location TBA. If successful, I'd very much like to do this regularly. So - who's in? Art Brown www.ArtBrownProductions.com
results.name: Practice Monologues

results.description:
Share, learn and network with fellow Product Managers at The Product Group.

Some topics to expect...
- Being Relevant 
- and more...

Featured Product: Rocketrip

From Kevin O'Neill, Product Person at Rocketrip:
"I’m the VP of Engineering and Product lead at a startup thats now been kicking around for a couple of years, Rocketrip (http://rocketrip.com).  Rocketrip provides companies a tool to help manage their overall spend on business travel by leveraging game mechanics to motivate employees to spend below dynamically set thresholds.  In short, we create budgets based off of real-time data, predict what the employee would have spent and then give the employee 40% of their savings (against our budget) in cash.  So if the employee saves $1,000, they pocket $400.  We’ve been hiring over the last year and are now poised to execute against our vision, which puts us in a really exciting position to build out our platform."


Note: Please make sure your meetup.com information is up-to-date (incl. First & Last names). You will need to show ID matching the name you used to RSVP. 


Hope to see you there!
results.name: The Product Group November 2015

We'll have two group leaders in case anyone wants to run a little slower or faster. Sorry all to all you experienced runners, but this is a running newbie only event. That being said, if you have any friends that you've been trying to convince to join you for a run with TMIRCE but they aren't feeling ready, this is a great place to get them started! results.description:
We are pleased to be co-sponsoring a screening of Beyond Measure, a documentary film that sets out to challenge the assumptions of the way we educate children in the United States.


Click here to buy tickets in advance for $15. If available, tickets will be sold at the door for $20. 

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=m4LTV8jat2o

More About the Film

Every day we hear stories about America’s troubled education system. And we’re told that in order to fix what’s broken, we need to narrow our curricula, standardize our classrooms, and find news ways to measure students and teachers. But what if these “fixes” are making our schools worse.In Beyond Measure, we set out to challenge the assumptions of our current education story.

Rather than ask why our students fail to measure up, this film asks us to reconsider the greater purpose of education. What if our education system valued personal growth over test scores? Put inquiry over mimicry? Encouraged passion over rankings? What if we decided that the higher aim of school was not the transmission of facts or formulas, but the transformation of every student? And what if this paradigm-shift was driven from the ground up? By students, parents, and educators? By all of us?

In Beyond Measure, we find a revolution brewing in public schools across the country. From rural Kentucky to New York City, schools that are breaking away from an outmoded, test-driven education are shaping a new vision for our classrooms. These are schools that see critical thinking, communication, exploration, experimentation, collaboration, and creativity as the key to good education. And they are dramatically improving outcomes for children of all backgrounds. They are schools where practically every student graduates and goes on to finish college.

Beyond Measure offers a positive picture of what’s possible in American education when communities decide they are ready for change. Are you?

results.description:
Get ready to get happier simply by talking about happiness! We'll be in the cafe. Look for our red Meetup sign. Please feel free to arrive late or leave early. It's great if you can RSVP in advance, but in case you can't, come anyway.

As a reminder, this group has two goals. The first is to explore the relationship between happiness and goodness. The second, much more fun, goal is for us to become much happier just by getting together and talking about happiness. The theory behind this second goal comes from a classic psychology study showing that by simply talking regularly about happiness we can become much happier.

While we'll often have set topics, like gratitude, acts of kindness, meditation and other happiness techniques, the following list of 14 topics will serve as a backdrop for our discussions.

1. Keep busy and be more active
2. Spend more time socializing
3. Be productive at meaningful work
4. Get better organized and plan things out
5. Stop worrying
6. Lower your expectations and aspirations
7. Develop positive, optimistic thinking
8. Become present oriented
9. Develop an outgoing, social personality
10. Work on a healthy personality
11. Be yourself
12. Eliminate negative feelings and problems
13. Close relationships are the number one source of happiness
14. Put happiness as your most important priority.

Here's some background on the research our group is based on.

In 1980 three New Zealand researchers found that after eight 2-hour conversation sessions about happiness over four weeks, their subjects reported a 22 percent increase in their happiness. Continuing their twice-weekly sessions, by the sixteenth week they reported being 42 percent happier.

Our list of topics comes from Fort Myers, Florida psychologist Michael Fordyce's "14 Fundamentals of Happiness." In 1977, Fordyce pioneered the science of happiness-increase with the world's first experiment designed to boost individual happiness.

That's the group, and those are our goals. It's also very, very important that we have fun. With that in mind, let's get ready to get good and happy!

Resources:

For those interested in learning about the major findings from social science research about happiness, and becoming happier, here are links to several excellent peer-reviewed articles that can be downloaded as pdf files for free. (Note: Although these classic articles are somewhat dated, decades of research on happiness reveal that findings on happiness tend to be extremely stable over time.)

Pursuing Happiness: The Architecture of Sustainable Change
By S Lyubomirsky, KM Sheldon and D Schkade, 2005.  21 pages

In Pursuit of Happiness: Empirical Answers to Philosophical Questions
By P Kesebir and E Diener, 2008. 9 pages.

Subjective Well-Being: Three Decades of Progress
By E Diener, EM Suh, RE Lucas and HL Smith, 1999. 27 pages

results.description:
On Dec.21st 2015, The Group That Shall Not Be Named will be 10 years old.

To celebrate this milestone we are starting a new multi-year project.

Starting with this Meetup, once a year we will provide scrap booking supplies and have each person at the event create one scrapbook page to put into a book that the org staff will assemble. The scrapbook pages should represent your own favorite moments, experiences, etc. with TGTSNBN during the past year.  These will be known as The Chronicles That Shall Not Be Named.


Each year will have its own volume, and we will have them out for special events, parties etc. And they will be photographed to create a digital version as well.

GUIDELINES AND DETAILS:

- This event has a $5 materials fee (plus 46 cent paypal fee). You can pay when you RSVP, or in cash at the Meetup (if you need to pay in cash at the Meetup MAKE SURE to mention this in your RSVP). If you can pay electronically, it makes the organizers lives WAY easier =)

- We will be providing a variety of 12x12 scrap book pages for each person from which to choose. Every attendee that evening will be allowed 1 page, with the possibility of a 2nd page, if we have additional supplies and space.

- If you are creating 2 pages, they need to be in a front to back style because of the scrapbook layout that we are using. Each person can only submit either 1 page or 1 front and back page to the scrap book.

- Please print out and bring your own photographs that you want to use. Photos should be either 3x5 or 4x6, we do not recommend photos larger than 4x6.

- Please bring your own scissors, if possible,  because we will have only 1-2 pairs to share.

- We will however have plenty of glue sticks, markers, crayons, and assorted scrap booking supplies. Also, feel free to bring any supplies of your own to use  and/or share.

This should be a fantastic event and we can't wait to see what you create!

UPDATE: We realized this Meetup might also be a good time for our members to make suggestions for events for next year. We will have a dry erase board up and will be jotting down your suggestions during the course of the night!

DISCLAIMER by Renee Knight

A brilliantly conceived, deeply unsettling psychological thriller— already an international sensation—about a woman haunted by secrets, the consuming desire for revenge, and the terrible price we pay when we try to hide the truth.

Finding a mysterious novel at her bedside plunges documentary filmmaker Catherine Ravenscroft into a living nightmare. Though ostensibly fiction, The Perfect Stranger recreates in vivid, unmistakable detail the terrible day she became hostage to a dark secret, a secret that only one other person knew—and that person is dead.

Now that the past is catching up with her, Catherine’s world is falling apart. Her only hope is to confront what really happened on that awful day . . . even if the shocking truth might destroy her.

Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias

[masked]
results.name: Futsal on Thursdays Midtown/7:30pm

results.description:
Real Self Defense is Offensive in nature. 

KravMaguy offers a true, authentic Israeli Defense Forces (IDF) training experience emphasizing hand-to-hand combat, tactical and warrior training for both men and women. The Head instructor was featured in the History Channel – The Human Weapon- a documentary about Krav Maga in Israel. His last assignment was as Tactical Security Team Leader working off the coast of East Africa. 

In this basics class you will learn to defend yourself and survive knife wielding assassins, sexual assaults or any would be attacker looking to take your life using the basic principles of kravmaguy level one system. In the end only your are responsible for your own protection. You cannot rely on others when split seconds count.

Topics covered in Level One 8 week course:
Jab cross 
Fighting Stance
Weak body spots
Hook uppercut
Basic footwork
Punching jab cross
Elbows regular
Knees
Groin strikes- knees, shin to groin, groin jab (lead leg)
Knife hands
Escape- RNC
Escape guillotine
Escape schoolyard headlock (requires matted area)
Physical requirements to pass level one:
20 pushups
35 sit ups
30 squats
Level 2 training prep


check out this youtube video to see kravmaguy knife defense in action, these techniques are used by murderers and terrorists to kill countless innocents and knowing these basic defenses can save your life and the ones you love

https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=BbzLjAUlyzU

the eye rake to elbow to the spine: a kravmaguy classic:
results.how_to_find_us: Price per class is $25.00. New students first class is $12.00, either RSVP or just show up. Tell the receptionist you are here for Krav Maga and turn right to the Martial Arts room- can't miss us.
results.name: Krav Maga Level One (NYSC)

results.description:
A warm welcome if this is the first Scottish dance evening you have thought of attending. The group offers the chance to enjoy and learn Scottish dancing in a relaxed and social setting. From September until June we offer an opportunity to warm up and do a simple dance with everyone and then to learn steps, patterns, and dances in a beginner class for part of the evening.  After the beginner session there's time to have refreshments, socialize and make new friends, and then dance socially with everyone.

This session is our end of series party! If you have country dance experience there will be dances you'll be able to do! If you brand-new to country dancing, feel free to come and watch, but you may want to wait one week until a new series begins on November 12th!

results.description:
Whether you're completely new to meditation, fresh out of an MBSR class, or an advanced practitioner wanting to find a local sangha (supportive, like-minded individuals who help deepen your practice), this weekly meditation is open to all.

Each meeting will include a guided meditation in the Vipassana (Mindfulness) tradition, led by MBSR instructor and meditation teacher, Kerry Rasp. Our sit will be followed by question/answer and discussion. Chairs provided, though feel free to bring a yoga mat, blanket or cushions. No charge, but dana (a donation) will be gratefully accepted.

* The Meetup RSVP list doesn't reflect actual attendance, since those from other meditation groups also attend.

results.description:
Very Important before attending. Please read this completely. We will be reading from Ascended Master written material for five Minutes or so and then practicing some simple Meditation Techniques of the Ascended Masters such as the I AM Decrees, Visualizations of the  Three Fold Heart flame and the Violet Consuming flame of forgiveness and more... There will also be Plenty of time for discussion and Questions and Answers. This Meditation Practice will be Guided with also some time for Silence practice. It will be for about 15-20 minutes. We will be having this Group every month. Practicing in a group is know to greatly enhance our Spiritual experience so please join us and see. We ask that everyone Practice Silence about their Personal Inner Spiritual Experiences at the meetup group and only speak in a very general and light way, like this worked for me or I felt Joy or love etc. without going into details and to Please Follow the Program Outlined by the Organizers. This will make for a more equality consciousness in the group with out people standing out as being more spiritually Conscious then others. It is not the purpose of this group to talk about our personal Spiritual experiences but to learn the teachings and techniques to have our own Spiritual experiences and Awakening, that is our focus.


Thanks and we Look forward to seeing you all then.


Peace & Blessings


Mindy & Anthony

results.description:
The NYC Junto will meet on Thursday November 5, 2015 at the General Society Library, 20 West 44th Street. Please arrive at 7:45 to hear the featured speaker. This event is free and open to the public.

The featured speaker will be legendary investor Victor Niederhoffer. Niederhoffer's topic will be the principles of financial speculation.

Niederhoffer is a hedge fund manager. He studied statistics and economics at Harvard ('64) and received a PhD from the University of Chicago ('69). He was the best squash player in the world in 1975. His autobiography is The Education of a Speculator, published in 1998 by John Wiley & Sons.

Founded in 1985, the NYC Junto is a monthly meeting hosted by Victor Niederhoffer and moderated by Barron's columnist Gene Epstein.

Related Links

NYCJunto.org

facebook.com/events/[masked]


meetup.com/NYCJunto


twitter.com/NYCJunto

twitter.com/VicNiederhoffer

Podcast: https://itun.es/us/oQ4F0.c

<a href="http://dailyspeculations.com/"></a>

results.description:
"Mixed Nuts" (by Justin Krebs, 11/5/15)

The off-year elections send off mixed messages:
from wins to regulate money in politics
to a loss for healthcare in Kentucky's gov race,
it's a foggy forecast for the year ahead.

The president's pursuing a mixed bag of policies:
banning the box and taking aim at criminal justice,
but putting boots on the ground in Syria,
and pursuing a deeply flawed TPP trade deal.

And then there's the mixed up GOP primary:
Carson rising on inane and insane comments,
Rubio rising as Jeb tries to "fix it,"
and Trump preparing for his SNL turn.

All told, it's a week of mixed politics,
but one thing that's totally clear:
The GOP field is a bunch of mixed nuts.

Come out for a drink and share what you think
with fellow like-minded left-leaners
at your local progressive social club.

Join us for our weekly gathering. As your busy week almost comes to an end, unwind with other similar-minded progressives over liberal libations.  

You can find us in the covered upper deck of the backyard -- look for a large banner on the wall, like the one shown above.  The NYC Chapter of Drinking Liberally has been gathering at Rudy's Bar & Grill since our in inception in 2003.
results.name: Weekly Thursday Meetup ("Mixed Nuts")

results.description:
Speak and Lead is one of three Toastmasters clubs in the Rutherford area. We cater to the after-work and evening crowd. Our goal is to help You obtain success! People join Toastmasters for an array of reasons, and therefore have different goals - but the common goal is self-improvement.

Whether you're joining so as to improve your communication/ presentation skills; or to become a better leader, Speak and Lead Toastmasters is here to help! Even if you simply are looking for an activity to engage in and just want to network, you can't go wrong here.

We're a friendly, supportive group that enjoys laughing and having a good time. We do things by the book and encourage all of our members to do their best. No matter what happens, we don't give up.

Won't you join us on your journey to success? The door is open - and we'll be talking.

results.description:
We are women who OM, and we want to tell you our stories. (An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the world think is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world hotter, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of her journey into Orgasmic Meditation. 

For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
We are women who OM, and we want to tell you our stories. (An Event for Women Only)

Charged. Vulnerable. Heated. Curious. Electric.

What happened throughout our lives - how we felt the timbres of our bones shaking and that undeniable yearning to know ourselves in this world more deeply. To push ourselves further, to love ourselves more; to live what we now know to be an Orgasmic Life. Orgasm. Power. Connection. Sex. Desire. Purpose.

We were touched by something wordless and visceral, impossible to explain, but harder to avoid. We argued with everything we’d ever been told about how our bodies should look, how much happiness we were allowed, how our relationships were supposed to go; we worked with our minds just enough to get bodies on the mat to feel that first stroke. And from that moment, everything changed. That smallest whisper that started out as “despite the fear, i want this” became “i can have it, because it’s my birthright”. That is how we live our lives; on the edge of believing, beyond what 99% of the world think is possible in the realm of sexuality, spirituality, business and relationship. We are people that would not otherwise meet; from bankers to dancers to electricians to actors to teachers to entrepreneurs. But we all want one thing; to make this world hotter, more intimate, and to put the passion inside of us to better use.

Join the New York women of the OM community for an evening of her journey into Orgasmic Meditation. For more information contact Marissa at[masked]
results.name: The Women who OM Series (An Event for Women Only)

results.description:
Want to: Meet your new ski/boarding buddy?  Learn about trips, lift ticket discounts, instruction, racing, hiking, and the amazing lodge in central Vermont?  Play free foosball, pool, shuffle board or darts?  Come to a meeting (maybe buy a drink at the bar at a good price) and introduce yourself to the person* closest to you and next thing you know you will be in the middle of 6 degrees of snow-mazing separation.  Thursdays from September to April, the snow networking location is at the Knights of Columbus (KofC) in Ramsey, 8 PM.

Park across the street in the train station parking lot. Many meetings have special speakers or activities, so keep an eye out for costume parties, equipment lectures, and amazing stuff.

FYI: Attendance varies (20-50 people usually) and represents only a small fraction of our 300+ membership base.  There will always be lots of dedicated skiers and boarders who are not on meetup.com who are in the official Ramapo Mountain Ski Club. Members vary in age (8-80 year olds come to meetings), ability, availability (schedule wise), and martial status (aka dating wise) - but everyone is looking for the perfect snow partner ;0)

Ramapo Mountain Ski Club Web Site

*For first timers: ask for Elyse, Ken of Hospitality, or Maggie, our President, to sign-in, help answer questions and connect you to others in the club with shared interests.

Ski yah Soon!

results.description:
• ABSOLUTELY NO CLEATS ALLOWED! NO EXCEPTIONS!!

• Permit Disclosure: No permit but field is usually unoccupied at this time.

• BRING AN ALL WHITE SHIRT (Your teammates can see you better when you wear white under the fluorescent vests.)

• We play rain or shine!

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

• PLEASE ARRIVE ON TIME - 8:00PM!! Game starts at 8:15pm sharp .

• NO BALL SMASHING! THIS IS A SPECIAL NIGHT BALL!

• Full rules explained at the game.

Code of Conduct:

Positivity - Constructive criticism after the game is way better than yelling and complaining during the game.

Safety - Want to kick someone really hard? go take jiujitsu. We like our shins.

2 = Teamwork. It takes 2 to complete every pass.

Generosity!!!! - Not just your money (though it helps). We want clapping and good cheers.

The proceeds go to our charity network: http://ps2g.org/charities

All RSVPs are final. No credits or refunds. (It's all for charity anyway)

If the game is cancelled, request a refund by filling out this form.

If you can't afford the meetup fees, please visit our website to learn how to become a game leader. Game Leaders play for free. http://ps2g.org/gameleaders

PS2G raises money for charities that use soccer for social good restoring dignity where it's been lost through the game of soccer. We share the impact of this movement through multiple channels and promote generosity on the field through safe and supportive play.

PS2G - Local Game. Global Change. 

Disclaimer By taking part in group activities you hereby are agreeing to the rules and regulation of the meetup. In addition, you acknowledge you are volunteering to play at your own self will and at your own risk. Neither organizer nor assistant organizers are responsible for any injuries or mishaps while partaking in the games. We encourage love of the game and for each other. We encourage friendly competition. Organizers reserve the right to remove players from the game if they refuse to be friendly.

(Leader- Chris W.)

(Co-leader- Pablo G.)

(We are looking for new Co-Leaders, are you interested? Talk to Chris W)

results.description:
“Blessed is the nation whose God is the Lord” (Ps 33:12, KJV)

Please join the Christian Party of America’s monthly Town Hall Conference Call to discuss current political issues with like-minded Christians. The conference call is the first Thursday of each month at 8:30 PM est. (7:30 PM central). Don Watson, National Vice-Chairman and North Carolina State Chairman will lead the discussion on what can be done to address the concerns we all share for the status of our country’s civil government. Earl Grover, National Board Member and Director of the Christian Men in Leadership and Veterans of the Constitution Divisions will lead us in prayer and spiritual insight about how we as Christians can turn our country back to its Christians heritage.

The Christian Party of America’s nationwide Conference Calls are a great opportunity to connect with other Christian Party supporters as we try to make a difference in this country. So sign on with us for the conference call to discuss issues and contribute your thoughts about what we can be doing politically. Our conference calls are open to the public and are for all of us who are interested in the Christian Party of America. It is an easy-access way to share ideas and learn more about what is going on around the country with the Christian Party of America. Hope you can make it!

The conference call will last for about an hour and a half, but staying for the entire call is optional. If you get a message that the circuits are busy, just keep trying the number and it eventually works. There is no extra charge to participate other than the usual charges by your phone plan for a long distance call. You can even listen in to the conference call while at other events...just hit *6 to mute your phone and you can do two things at once!
results.name: Christian Party Town Hall Conference Call

results.description:
Futsal Pick up games (intermediate to advanced level)

Fee: $10 dollars per player per game; pay through paypal.

Only 10 players per game, no subs (the roster shows 11 spots only because it includes the organizer who will play if needed). One game is 55-60 minutes. Please come a little early so that we all can start on time and play 1 solid hour. Goal keeper rotation every 5-6 minutes. We play without a break. Regulation size goals with nets. Futsal ball. Please make sure to bring a white and a red t-shirt (if you don't have red, a solid dark will do), indoor shoes. Games are competitive, but friendly. Please keep in mind that these games are definitely not for the beginners. Please no fouls, zero tolerance to this. “Futsal is not a physical but a technical game ”. Minimum physical contact means fewer injuries and no violence.

more info at [masked]

Thank you,

Jaime Arias
